[%livingentities%] (is not|isn't) holding %itemtypes% in off[(-| )]hand

creator: bensku
title: Comparison
description:
A very general condition, it simply compares two values. Usually you can only compare for equality (e.g. block is/isn't of <type>), but some values can also be compared using greater than/less than. In that case you can also test for whether an object is between two others.
Note: This is the only element where not all patterns are shown. It has actually another two sets of similar patters, but with (was|were) or will be instead of (is|are) respectively, which check different time states of the first expression.
syntax_pattern:
(neither|) %objects% ((is|are)(|(n't| not| neither)) ((greater|more|higher|bigger|larger) than|above)|\>) %objects%
(neither|) %objects% ((is|are)(|(n't| not| neither)) (greater|more|higher|bigger|larger|above) [than] or (equal to|the same as)|\>=) %objects%
(neither|) %objects% ((is|are)(|(n't| not| neither)) ((less|smaller|lower) than|below)|\<) %objects%
(neither|) %objects% ((is|are)(|(n't| not| neither)) (less|smaller|lower|below) [than] or (equal to|the same as)|\<=) %objects%
(neither|) %objects% ((is|are) (not|neither)|isn't|aren't|!=) [equal to] %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (is|are|=) [(equal to|the same as)] %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (is|are) between %objects% and %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (is not|are not|isn't|aren't) between %objects% and %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (was|were)(|(n't| not| neither)) ((greater|more|higher|bigger|larger) than|above) %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (was|were)(|(n't| not| neither)) (greater|more|higher|bigger|larger|above) [than] or (equal to|the same as) %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (was|were)(|(n't| not| neither)) ((less|smaller|lower) than|below) %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (was|were)(|(n't| not| neither)) (less|smaller|lower|below) [than] or (equal to|the same as) %objects%
(neither|) %objects% ((was|were) (not|neither)|wasn't|weren't) [equal to] %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (was|were) [(equal to|the same as)] %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (was|were) between %objects% and %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (was not|were not|wasn't|weren't) between %objects% and %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (will be|(will (not|neither) be|won't be)) ((greater|more|higher|bigger|larger) than|above) %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (will be|(will (not|neither) be|won't be)) (greater|more|higher|bigger|larger|above) [than] or (equal to|the same as) %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (will be|(will (not|neither) be|won't be)) ((less|smaller|lower) than|below) %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (will be|(will (not|neither) be|won't be)) (less|smaller|lower|below) [than] or (equal to|the same as) %objects%
(neither|) %objects% ((will (not|neither) be|won't be)|(isn't|aren't|is not|are not) (turning|changing) [in]to) [equal to] %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (will be [(equal to|the same as)]|(is|are) (turning|changing) [in]to) %objects%
(neither|) %objects% will be between %objects% and %objects%
(neither|) %objects% (will not be|won't be) between %objects% and %objects%

creator: bensku
title: On Throwing of an Egg
description: Called when a player throws an egg. You can just use the shoot event in most cases, as this event is intended to support changing the hatched mob and its chance to hatch, but Skript does not yet support that.

creator: Blueyescat
title: On Swim Toggle
description: Called when an entity swims or stops swimming.

creator: Blueyescat
title: On Sheep Regrow Wool
description: Called when sheep regrows its sheared wool back.

creator: Blueyescat
title: On Language Change
description:
Called after a player changed their language in the game settings. You can use the language expression to get the current language of the player.
This event requires Minecraft 1.12+.

creator: bensku
title: On Join
description: Called when the player joins the server. The player is already in a world when this event is called, so if you want to prevent players from joining you should prefer on connect over this event.

creator: bensku
title: On Hunger Meter Change
description: Called when the hunger bar of a player changes, i.e. either increases by eating or decreases over time.

creator: bensku
title: On Gliding State Change
description: Called when an entity toggles glider on or off, or when server toggles gliding state of an entity forcibly.

creator: Blueyescat
title: On Flight Toggle
description: Called when a players stops/starts flying.

creator: bensku
title: On Fade
description: Called when a block 'fades away', e.g. ice or snow melts.
event_values: event-block, event-location, event-world, future event-block, past event-block

creator: eyesniper2
title: On Entity Portal
description: Called when an entity uses a nether or end portal. Cancel the event to prevent the entity from teleporting.
event_values: event-command sender, event-entity, event-location, event-world, past event-location

creator: bensku
title: On Entity Mount
description: Called when entity starts riding another.

creator: Blueyescat
title: On Dispense
description: Called when a dispenser dispenses an item.

creator: bensku
title: On Chat
description:
Called whenever a player chats.
Use chat format to change message format.
Use chat recipients to edit chat recipients.

creator: bensku
title: On Can Build Check
description:
Called when a player rightclicks on a block while holding a block or a placeable item. You can either cancel the event to prevent the block from being built, or uncancel it to allow it.
Please note that the data value of the block to be placed is not available in this event, only its ID.
event_values: event-block, event-location, event-player, event-world, past event-block

creator: bensku
title: On Block Growth
description: Called when a crop grows. Alternative to new form of generic grow event.

creator: eyesniper2
title: On Block Fertilize
description: Called when a player fertilizes blocks.

creator: bensku
title: On Block Damage
description: Called when a player starts to break a block. You can usually just use the leftclick event for this.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Potion Effect
description: A potion effect, including the potion effect type, tier and duration.
type_usage: speed of tier 1 for 10 seconds

creator: eyesniper2
title: Whitelist
description:
An expression for obtaining and modifying the server's whitelist.
Players may be added and removed from the whitelist.
The whitelist can be enabled or disabled by setting the whitelist to true or false respectively.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Sea Level
description: Gets the sea level of a world.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Random UUID
description: Returns a random UUID.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Projectile Critical State
description: A projectile's critical state. The only currently accepted projectiles are arrows and tridents.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Potion Effects
description:
Represents the active potion effects of entities and itemtypes.
You can clear all potion effects of an entity/itemtype and add/remove a potion effect/type to/from an entity/itemtype.
Do note you will not be able to clear the base potion effects of a potion item. In that case, just set the item to a water bottle.
When adding a potion effect type (rather than a potion effect), it will default to 15 seconds with tier 1.
syntax_pattern:
[the] [(all [[of] the]|the)] [active] potion effects of %livingentities/itemtypes%
%livingentities/itemtypes%'[s] [(all [[of] the]|the)] [active] potion effects

creator: bensku
title: Numbers
description:
All numbers between two given numbers, useful for looping.
Use 'numbers' if your start is not an integer and you want to keep the fractional part of the start number constant, or use 'integers' if you only want to loop integers.
You may also use 'decimals' if you want to use the decimal precision of the start number.
You may want to use the 'times' expression instead, for instance 'loop 5 times:'

creator: eyesniper2
title: Minecart Derailed / Flying Velocity
description: The velocity of a minecart as soon as it has been derailed or as soon as it starts flying.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Mending Repair Amount
description:
The number of durability points an item is to be repaired in a mending event.
 Modifying the repair amount will affect how much experience is given to the player after mending.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Max Minecart Speed
description: The maximum speed of a minecart.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Last Damage
description: The last damage that was done to an entity. Note that changing it doesn't deal more/less damage.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Inventory Holder/Viewers/Rows/Slots
description:
Gets the amount of rows/slots, viewers and holder of an inventory.

NOTE: 'Viewers' expression returns a list of players viewing the inventory. Note that a player is considered to be viewing their own inventory and internal crafting screen even when said inventory is not open.
syntax_pattern:
(holder[s]|viewers|[amount of] rows|[amount of] slots) of %inventories%
%inventories%'[s] (holder[s]|viewers|[amount of] rows|[amount of] slots)

creator: eyesniper2
title: Heal Amount
description: The amount of health healed in a heal event.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Drops Of Block
description: A list of the items that will drop when a block is broken.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Arrow Knockback Strength
description: An arrow's knockback strength.
syntax_pattern:
[the] arrow knockback strength of %projectiles%
%projectiles%'[s] arrow knockback strength

creator: eyesniper2
title: Swing Hand
description: Makes an entity swing their hand. This does nothing if the entity does not have an animation for swinging their hand.
syntax_pattern:
make %livingentities% swing [their] [main] hand
make %livingentities% swing [their] off[ ]hand

creator: eyesniper2
title: Send Block Change
description: Makes a player see a block as something else or as the original.
syntax_pattern:
make %players% see %locations% as %itemtype/blockdata%
make %players% see %locations% as [the|its] (original|normal|actual) [block]

creator: eyesniper2
title: Open Book
description: Opens a written book to a player.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Message
description:
Sends a message to the given player. Only styles written
in given string or in formatted expressions will be parsed.
Adding an optional sender allows the messages to be sent as if a specific player sent them.
This is useful with Minecraft 1.16.4's new chat ignore system, in which players can choose to ignore other players,
but for this to work, the message needs to be sent from a player.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Force Attack
description: Makes a living entity attack an entity with a melee attack.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Matches
description: Checks whether the defined strings match the input regexes (Regular expressions).
syntax_pattern:
%strings% (match[es]|do[es](n't| not) match) %strings%
%strings% (partially match[es]|do[es](n't| not) partially match) %strings%

creator: eyesniper2
title: Is Unbreakable
description: Checks whether an item is unbreakable.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Is Passable
description:
Checks whether a block is passable.
A block is passable if it has no colliding parts that would prevent players from moving through it.
Blocks like tall grass, flowers, signs, etc. are passable, but open doors, fence gates, trap doors, etc. are not because they still have parts that can be collided with.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Is Occluding
description: Checks whether an item is a block and completely blocks vision.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Is Normalized
description: Checks whether a vector is normalized i.e. length of 1

creator: eyesniper2
title: Is Interactable
description: Checks wether or not a block is interactable.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Is Fuel
description: Checks whether an item can be used as fuel in a furnace.

creator: eyesniper2
title: On Item Mend
description: Called when a player has an item repaired via the Mending enchantment.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Block Data
description: Block data is the detailed information about a block, referred to in Minecraft as BlockStates, allowing for the manipulation of different aspects of the block, including shape, waterlogging, direction the block is facing, and so much more. Information regarding each block's optional data can be found on Minecraft's Wiki. Find the block you're looking for and scroll down to 'Block States'. Different states must be separated by a semicolon (see examples). The 'minecraft:' namespace is optional, as well as are underscores.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Last/First Login Time
description: When a player last/first logged in the server. 'last login' requires paper to get the last login, otherwise it will get the last time they were seen on the server.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Heal Reason
description: The heal reason of a heal event.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Fertilized Blocks
description: The blocks fertilized in block fertilize events.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Stop Server
description: Stops or restarts the server. If restart is used when the restart-script spigot.yml option isn't defined, the server will stop instead.

creator: eyesniper2
title: On Enchant
description:
Called when a player successfully enchants an item.
 To get the enchanted item, see the enchant item expression
event_values: event-block, event-enchantment types, event-inventory, event-item stack, event-player

creator: eyesniper2
title: Gamerule Value
description: A wrapper for the value of a gamerule for a world.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Enchantment Offer
description: The enchantmentoffer in an enchant prepare event.

creator: bensku
title: Level Progress
description:
The player's progress in reaching the next level, this represents the experience bar in the game. Please note that this value is between 0 and 1 (e.g. 0.5 = half experience bar).
Changing this value can cause the player's level to change if the resulting level progess is negative or larger than 1, e.g. increase the player's level progress by 0.5 will make the player gain a level if their progress was more than 50%.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Gamerule Value
description: The gamerule value of a world.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Fall Distance
description: The distance an entity has fallen for.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Explosion Yield
description:
The yield of the explosion in an explosion prime event. This is how big the explosion is.
 When changing the yield, values less than 0 will be ignored.
 Read this wiki page for more information

creator: eyesniper2
title: Explosion Block Yield
description:
The percentage of exploded blocks dropped in an explosion event.
When changing the yield, a value greater than 1 will function the same as using 1.
Attempting to change the yield to a value less than 0 will have no effect.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Entity Attribute
description:
The numerical value of an entity's particular attribute.
Note that the movement speed attribute cannot be reliably used for players. For that purpose, use the speed expression instead.
Resetting an entity's attribute is only available in Minecraft 1.11 and above.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Enchantment Offer Cost
description:
The cost of an enchantment offer. This is displayed to the right of an enchantment offer.
If the cost is changed, it will always be at least 1.
This changes how many levels are required to enchant, but does not change the number of levels removed.
To change the number of levels removed, use the enchant event.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Enchantment Offer
description: The enchantment offer in enchant prepare events.
syntax_pattern:
[all [of]] [the] enchant[ment] offers
enchant[ment] offer[s] %numbers%
[the] %number%(st|nd|rd|th) enchant[ment] offer

creator: eyesniper2
title: Enchantment Bonus
description: The enchantment bonus in an enchant prepare event. This represents the number of bookshelves affecting/surrounding the enchantment table.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Enchant Item
description:
The enchant item in an enchant prepare event or enchant event.
It can be modified, but enchantments will still be applied in the enchant event.

creator: bensku
title: Damage
description:
How much damage is done in a entity/vehicle/item damage events.
For entity damage events, possibly ignoring armour, criticals and/or enchantments (remember that in Skript '1' is one full heart, not half a heart).
For items, it's the amount of durability damage the item will be taking.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Applied Enchantments
description:
The applied enchantments in an enchant event.
 Deleting or removing the applied enchantments will prevent the item's enchantment.

creator: bensku
title: Altitude
description: Effectively an alias of 'y-coordinate of …', it represents the height of some location within the world.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Make Incendiary
description: Sets if an entity's explosion will leave behind fire. This effect is also usable in an explosion prime event.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Is Incendiary
description: Checks if an entity will create fire when it explodes. This condition is also usable in an explosion prime event.
syntax_pattern:
%entities% ((is|are) incendiary|cause[s] a[n] (incendiary|fiery) explosion)
%entities% ((is not|are not|isn't|aren't) incendiary|(does not|do not|doesn't|don't) cause[s] a[n] (incendiary|fiery) explosion)
the [event(-| )]explosion (is|(is not|isn't)) (incendiary|fiery)

creator: eyesniper2
title: Firework Type
description: The type of a fireworkeffect.
type_usage: small, ball, star shaped, large, star, creeper face, small ball, large ball, burst, ball large, creeper

creator: eyesniper2
title: Unix Date
description: Converts given Unix timestamp to a date. The Unix timespan represents the number of seconds elapsed since 1 January 1970.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Time Played
description:
The amount of time a player has played for on the server. This info is stored in the player's statistics in the main world's data folder. Changing this will also change the player's stats which can be views in the client's statistics menu.
Using this expression on offline players on Minecraft 1.14 and below will return nothing <none>.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Redstone Block Power
description: Power of a redstone block

creator: eyesniper2
title: Number of Characters
description: The number of uppercase, lowercase, or digit characters in a string.
syntax_pattern:
number of upper[ ]case char(acters|s) in %string%
number of lower[ ]case char(acters|s) in %string%
number of digit char(acters|s) in %string%

creator: eyesniper2
title: No Damage Ticks
description: The number of ticks that an entity is invulnerable to damage for.

creator: eyesniper2
title: New Line
description: Returns a line break separator.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Max Durability
description:
The maximum durability of an item. Changing requires Minecraft 1.20.5+
Note: 'delete' will remove the max durability from the item (making it a non-damageable item). Delete requires Paper 1.21+

creator: eyesniper2
title: Item with Custom Model Data
description: Get an item with custom model data.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Hotbar Button
description: The hotbar button clicked in an inventory click event.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Exploded Blocks
description: Get all the blocks that were destroyed in an explode event. Supports add/remove/set/clear/delete blocks.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Entity Owner
description: The owner of a tameable entity, such as a horse or wolf.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Entity AI
description: Returns whether an entity has AI.

creator: bensku
title: Case Text
description: Copy of given text in Lowercase, Uppercase, Proper Case, camelCase, PascalCase, Snake_Case, and Kebab-Case
syntax_pattern:
%strings% in (upper|lower)[ ]case
(upper|lower)[ ]case %strings%
capitali(s|z)ed %strings%
%strings% in [(lenient|strict) ](proper|title)[ ]case
[(lenient|strict) ](proper|title)[ ]case %strings%
%strings% in [(lenient|strict) ]camel[ ]case
[(lenient|strict) ]camel[ ]case %strings%
%strings% in [(lenient|strict) ]pascal[ ]case
[(lenient|strict) ]pascal[ ]case %strings%
%strings% in [(lower|upper|capital|screaming)[ ]]snake[ ]case
[(lower|upper|capital|screaming)[ ]]snake[ ]case %strings%
%strings% in [(lower|upper|capital)[ ]]kebab[ ]case
[(lower|upper|capital)[ ]]kebab[ ]case %strings%

creator: eyesniper2
title: Absorbed blocks
description: The blocks absorbed by a sponge block.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Silence Entity
description: Controls whether or not an entity is silent.
syntax_pattern:
silence %entities%
unsilence %entities%
make %entities% silent
make %entities% not silent

creator: eyesniper2
title: Make Invulnerable
description: Makes an entity invulnerable/not invulnerable.

creator: bensku
title: Explosion
description:
Creates an explosion of a given force. The Minecraft Wiki has an article on explosions which lists the explosion forces of TNT, creepers, etc.
Hint: use a force of 0 to create a fake explosion that does no damage whatsoever, or use the explosion effect introduced in Skript 2.0.
Starting with Bukkit 1.4.5 and Skript 2.0 you can use safe explosions which will damage entities but won't destroy any blocks.
syntax_pattern:
[(create|make)] [an] explosion (of|with) (force|strength|power) %number% [%directions% %locations%] [(with fire)]
[(create|make)] [a] safe explosion (of|with) (force|strength|power) %number% [%directions% %locations%]
[(create|make)] [a] fake explosion [%directions% %locations%]
[(create|make)] [an] explosion[ ]effect [%directions% %locations%]

creator: eyesniper2
title: Explode Creeper
description: Starts the explosion process of a creeper or instantly explodes it.
syntax_pattern:
instantly explode [creeper[s]] %livingentities%
explode [creeper[s]] %livingentities% instantly
ignite creeper[s] %livingentities%
start (ignition|explosion) [process] of [creeper[s]] %livingentities%
stop (ignition|explosion) [process] of [creeper[s]] %livingentities%

creator: eyesniper2
title: Charge Creeper
description: Charges or uncharges a creeper. A creeper is charged when it has been struck by lightning.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Is Tameable
description: Check if an entity is tameable.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Is Silent
description: Checks whether an entity is silent i.e. its sounds are disabled.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Is Riptiding
description: Checks to see if an entity is currently using the Riptide enchantment.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Is Leashed
description: Checks to see if an entity is currently leashed.

creator: bensku
title: Is Blocking
description: Checks whether a player is blocking with their shield.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Is Block Redstone Powered
description: Checks if a block is indirectly or directly powered by redstone
syntax_pattern:
%blocks% (is|are) redstone powered
%blocks% (is|are) indirectly redstone powered
%blocks% (is|are)(n't| not) redstone powered
%blocks% (is|are)(n't| not) indirectly redstone powered

creator: eyesniper2
title: Has Custom Model Data
description: Check if an item has a custom model data tag
syntax_pattern:
%itemtypes% (has|have) [custom] model data [floats|flags|strings|colo[u]rs]
%itemtypes% (doesn't|does not|do not|don't) have [custom] model data [floats|flags|strings|colo[u]rs]

creator: eyesniper2
title: Has AI
description: Checks whether an entity has AI.

creator: eyesniper2
title: On Sponge Absorb
description: Called when a sponge absorbs blocks.

creator: eyesniper2
title: On Item Damage
description: Called when an item is damaged. Most tools are damaged by using them; armor is damaged when the wearer takes damage.

creator: Blueyescat
title: On Inventory Click
description: Called when clicking on inventory slot.
event_values: event-click type, event-inventory, event-inventory action, event-item stack, event-player, event-slot, event-text, event-world

creator: bensku
title: On Chunk Unload
description: Called when a chunk is unloaded due to not being near any player.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Spawner Type
description:
The entity type of a spawner (mob spawner).
Change the entity type, reset it (pig) or clear it (Minecraft 1.20.0+).

creator: Blueyescat
title: Color Items
description: Colors items in a given color. You can also use RGB codes if you feel limited with the 16 default colors. RGB codes are three numbers from 0 to 255 in the order (red, green, blue), where (0,0,0) is black and (255,255,255) is white. Armor is colorable for all Minecraft versions. With Minecraft 1.11 or newer you can also color potions and maps. Note that the colors might not look exactly how you'd expect.

creator: eyesniper2
title: log
description:
A logarithm, with base 10 if none is specified. This is the inverse operation to exponentiation (for positive bases only), i.e. log(base ^ exponent, base) = exponent for any positive number 'base' and any number 'exponent'.
Another useful equation is base ^ log(a, base) = a for any numbers 'base' and 'a'.
Please note that due to how numbers are represented in computers, these equations do not hold for all numbers, as the computed values may slightly differ from the correct value.
Returns NaN (not a number) if any of the arguments are negative.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Entity
description: An entity is something in a world that's not a block, e.g. a player, a skeleton, or a zombie, but also projectiles like arrows, fireballs or thrown potions, or special entities like dropped items, falling blocks or paintings.
type_usage: player, op, wolf, tamed ocelot, powered creeper, zombie, unsaddled pig, fireball, arrow, dropped item, item frame, etc.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Color
description: Wool, dye and chat colors.
type_usage: black, dark grey/dark gray, grey/light grey/gray/light gray/silver, white, blue/dark blue, cyan/aqua/dark cyan/dark aqua, light blue/light cyan/light aqua, green/dark green, light green/lime/lime green, yellow/light yellow, orange/gold/dark yellow, red/dark red, pink/light red, purple/dark purple, magenta/light purple, brown/indigo

creator: bensku
title: Vectors - Spherical Shape
description: Forms a 'spherical shaped' vector using yaw and pitch to manipulate the current point.

creator: bensku
title: Vectors - Cylindrical Shape
description: Forms a 'cylindrical shaped' vector using yaw to manipulate the current point.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Ping
description: Pings of players, as Minecraft server knows them. Note that they will almost certainly be different from the ones you'd get from using ICMP echo requests. This expression is only supported on some server software (PaperSpigot).

creator: bensku
title: Parse
description:
Parses text as a given type, or as a given pattern.
This expression can be used in two different ways: One which parses the entire text as a single instance of a type, e.g. as a number, and one that parses the text according to a pattern.
If the given text could not be parsed, this expression will return nothing and the parse error will be set if some information is available.
Some notes about parsing with a pattern:
- The pattern must be a Skript pattern, e.g. percent signs are used to define where to parse which types, e.g. put a %number% or %items% in the pattern if you expect a number or some items there.
- You have to save the expression's value in a list variable, e.g. set {parsed::*} to message parsed as "...".
- The list variable will contain the parsed values from all %types% in the pattern in order. If a type was plural, e.g. %items%, the variable's value at the respective index will be a list variable, e.g. the values will be stored in {parsed::1::*}, not {parsed::1}.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Vector
description: Vector is a collection of numbers. In Minecraft, 3D vectors are used to express velocities of entities.
type_usage: vector(x, y, z)

creator: eyesniper2
title: Type
description:
Represents a type, e.g. number, object, item type, location, block, world, entity type, etc.
This is mostly used for expressions like 'event-<type>', '<type>-argument', 'loop-<type>', etc., e.g. event-world, number-argument and loop-player.
type_usage: See the type name patterns of all types - including this one

creator: eyesniper2
title: Tree Type
description: A tree type represents a tree species or a huge mushroom species. These can be generated in a world with the generate tree effect.
type_usage:
[any] <general tree/mushroom type>, e.g. tree/any jungle tree/etc.
<specific tree/mushroom species>, e.g. red mushroom/small jungle tree/big regular tree/etc.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Timeperiod
description:
A period of time between two times. Mostly useful since you can use this to test for whether it's day, night, dusk or dawn in a specific world.
This type might be removed in the future as you can use 'time of world is between x and y' as a replacement.
type_usage:
##:## - ##:##
dusk/day/dawn/night

creator: eyesniper2
title: Time
description:
A time is a point in a minecraft day's time (i.e. ranges from 0:00 to 23:59), which can vary per world.
See date and timespan for the other time types of Skript.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Inventory
description:
An inventory of a player or block. Inventories have many effects and conditions regarding the items contained.
An inventory has a fixed amount of slots which represent a specific place in the inventory, e.g. the helmet slot for players (Please note that slot support is still very limited but will be improved eventually).

creator: Blueyescat
title: Firework Type
description: The type of a fireworkeffect.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Direction
description:
A direction, e.g. north, east, behind, 5 south east, 1.3 meters to the right, etc.
Locations and some blocks also have a direction, but without a length.
Please note that directions have changed extensively in the betas and might not work perfectly. They can also not be used as command arguments.
type_usage: see direction (expression)

creator: bensku
title: Vectors - Vector from Location
description: Creates a vector from a location.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Portal
description: The blocks associated with a portal in the portal creation event.

creator: bensku
title: Direction
description: A helper expression for the direction type.
syntax_pattern:
[%number% [(block|met(er|re))[s]] [to the]] (north[(-| |)(east|west)][(ward(s|ly|)|er(n|ly|))] [of]|south[(-| |)(east|west)][(ward(s|ly|)|er(n|ly|))] [of]|(east|west)[(ward(s|ly|)|er(n|ly|))] [of]|above|over|(up|down)[ward(s|ly|)]|below|under[neath]|beneath) [%direction%]
[%number% [(block|met(er|re))[s]]] in [the] (direction|horizontal direction|facing|horizontal facing) of %entity/block% (of|from|)
[%number% [(block|met(er|re))[s]]] in %entity/block%'[s] (direction|horizontal direction|facing|horizontal facing) (of|from|)
[%number% [(block|met(er|re))[s]]] (in[ ]front [of]|forward[s]|behind|backwards|[to the] (right|left) [of])
[%number% [(block|met(er|re))[s]]] horizontal[ly] (in[ ]front [of]|forward[s]|behind|backwards|to the (right|left) [of])

creator: Blueyescat
title: Keep Inventory / Experience
description: Keeps the inventory or/and experiences of the dead player in a death event.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Game Mode
description: The game modes survival, creative, adventure and spectator.
type_usage: adventure, survival, spectator, creative

creator: eyesniper2
title: Chunk
description: A chunk is a cuboid of 16×16×128 (x×z×y) blocks. Chunks are spread on a fixed rectangular grid in their world.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Boolean
description: A boolean is a value that is either true or false. Other accepted names are 'on' and 'yes' for true, and 'off' and 'no' for false.
type_usage: true/yes/on or false/no/off

creator: eyesniper2
title: Block
description: A block in a world. It has a location and a type, and can also have a direction (mostly a facing), an inventory, or other special properties.

creator: eyesniper2
title: World Seed
description: The seed of given world. Note that it will be returned as Minecraft internally treats seeds, not as you specified it in world configuration.

creator: bensku
title: Vehicle
description:
The vehicle an entity is in, if any. This can actually be any entity, e.g. spider jockeys are skeletons that ride on a spider, so the spider is the 'vehicle' of the skeleton.
See also: passenger

creator: bensku
title: Vectors - Yaw and Pitch
description: Gets or sets the yaw or pitch value of a vector.

creator: bensku
title: Vectors - XYZ Component
description: Gets or changes the x, y or z component of a vector.

creator: bensku
title: Vectors - Vector Between Locations
description: Creates a vector between two locations.

creator: bensku
title: Vectors - Squared Length
description: Gets the squared length of a vector.

creator: bensku
title: Vectors - Location Vector Offset
description: Returns the location offset by vectors.

creator: bensku
title: Vectors - Length
description: Gets or sets the length of a vector.

creator: bensku
title: Vectors - Arithmetic
description: Arithmetic expressions for vectors.

creator: bensku
title: Unix Timestamp
description: Converts given date to Unix timestamp. This is roughly how many seconds have elapsed since 1 January 1970.

creator: bensku
title: UUID
description: The UUID of a player, entity or world.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Temperature
description: Temperature at given block.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Teleport Cause
description: The teleport cause within a player teleport event.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Special Number
description: Special number values, namely NaN, Infinity and -Infinity

creator: bensku
title: Spawn
description: The spawn point of a world.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Slot Index
description:
Index of an an inventory slot. Other types of slots may or may not have indices. Note that comparing slots with numbers is also possible; if index of slot is same as the number, comparisonsucceeds. This expression is mainly for the cases where you must for some reason save the slot numbers.

Raw index of slot is unique for the view, see Minecraft Wiki

creator: Blueyescat
title: Reversed List
description: Reverses given list.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Player Visibility
description:
Change visibility of a player for the given players.
When reveal is used in combination of the hidden players expression and the viewers are not specified, this will default it to the given player in the hidden players expression.

Note: if a player was hidden and relogs, this player will be visible again.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Alphanumeric
description: Checks if the given string is alphanumeric.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Play Effect
description:
Plays a visual effect at a given location or on a given entity.
Please note that some effects can only be played on entities, e.g. wolf hearts or the hurt effect, and that these are always visible to all players.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Launch firework
description: Launch firework effects at the given location(s).

creator: Blueyescat
title: Hide Player from Server List
description: Hides a player from the hover list and decreases the online players count (only if the player count wasn't changed before).
syntax_pattern:
hide %players% (in|on|from) [the] server list
hide %players%'[s] info[rmation] (in|on|from) [the] server list

creator: Blueyescat
title: Break Block
description:
Breaks the block and spawns items as if a player had mined it

You can add a tool, which will spawn items based on how that tool would break the block 
(ie: When using a hand to break stone, it drops nothing, whereas with a pickaxe it drops cobblestone)

creator: Blueyescat
title: Has Resource Pack
description: Checks whether the given players have a server resource pack loaded. Please note that this can't detect player's own resource pack, only the resource pack that sent by the server.
syntax_pattern:
%players% (has|have) [a] resource pack [(loaded|installed)]
%players% (doesn't|does not|do not|don't) have [a] resource pack [(loaded|installed)]

creator: Blueyescat
title: On Drop
description: Called when a player drops an item from their inventory, or an entity drops an item, such as a chicken laying an egg.
event_values: event-command sender, event-dropped item, event-entity, event-entity type, event-item stack, event-location, event-player, event-world

creator: Blueyescat
title: Scoreboard Tags
description:
Scoreboard tags are simple list of texts stored directly in the data of an entity.
So this is a Minecraft related thing, not Bukkit, so the tags will not get removed when the server stops. You can visit visit Minecraft Wiki for more info.
This is changeable and valid for any type of entity. Also you can use use the Has Scoreboard Tag condition to check whether an entity has the given tags.

Requires Minecraft 1.11+ (actually added in 1.9 to the game, but added in 1.11 to Spigot).
syntax_pattern:
[(all [[of] the]|the)] scoreboard tags of %entities%
%entities%'[s] scoreboard tags

creator: Blueyescat
title: Spectator Target
description: Grabs the spectator target entity of the players.

creator: Blueyescat
title: On Hand Item Swap
description:
Called whenever a player swaps the items in their main- and offhand slots.
Works also when one or both of the slots are empty.
The event is called before the items are actually swapped,
so when you use the player's tool or player's offtool expressions,
they will return the values before the swap -
this enables you to cancel the event before anything happens.

creator: bensku
title: On Experience Spawn
description:
Called whenever experience is about to spawn.
Please note that this event will not fire for xp orbs spawned by plugins (including Skript) with Bukkit.

creator: bensku
title: On Entity Dismount
description: Called when an entity dismounts.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Highest Solid Block
description: Returns the highest solid block at the x and z coordinates of the world of a given location.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Flight Mode
description: Whether the player(s) are allowed to fly. Use Make Fly effect to force player(s) to fly.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Exhaustion
description: The exhaustion of a player. This is mainly used to determine the rate of hunger depletion.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Custom Chest Inventory
description: Returns a chest inventory with the given amount of rows and the name. Use the open inventory effect to open it.
syntax_pattern:
[a] [new] chest inventory (named|with name) %string% [with %number% row[s]]
[a] [new] chest inventory with %number% row[s] [(named|with name) %string%]

creator: eyesniper2
title: Make Fly
description: Forces a player to start/stop flying.
syntax_pattern:
force %players% to [(start|stop)] fly[ing]
make %players% (start|stop) flying
make %players% fly

creator: eyesniper2
title: Feed
description: Feeds the specified players.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Cancel Command Cooldown
description: Only usable in commands. Makes it so the current command usage isn't counted towards the cooldown.

creator: bensku
title: On Sneak Toggle
description: Called when a player starts or stops sneaking. Use is sneaking to get whether the player was sneaking before the event was called.

creator: bensku
title: On Enderman/Sheep/Silverfish
description: Called when an enderman places or picks up a block, a sheep eats grass or a silverfish boops into/out of a block respectively.
syntax_pattern:
[on] enderman place
[on] enderman pickup
[on] sheep eat
[on] silverfish enter
[on] silverfish exit

creator: bensku
title: On Connect
description: Called when the player connects to the server. This event is called before the player actually joins the server, so if you want to prevent players from joining you should prefer this event over on join.

creator: bensku
title: On Bed Leave
description: Called when a player leaves a bed.

creator: bensku
title: At Time
description: An event that occurs at a given minecraft time in every world or only in specific worlds.

creator: bensku
title: Vectors - Cross Product
description: Gets the cross product between two vectors.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Date Ago/Later
description: A date the specified timespan before/after another date.

creator: bensku
title: Attacker
description:
The attacker of a damage event, e.g. when a player attacks a zombie this expression represents the player.
Please note that the attacker can also be a block, e.g. a cactus or lava, but this expression will not be set in these cases.

creator: eyesniper2
title: World
description: One of the server's worlds. Worlds can be put into scripts by surrounding their name with double quotes, e.g. "world_nether", but this might not work reliably as text uses the same syntax.
type_usage: "world_name", e.g. "world"

creator: eyesniper2
title: Weather Type
description: The weather types sunny, rainy, and thundering.
type_usage: clear/sun/sunny, rain/rainy/raining, and thunder/thundering/thunderstorm

creator: eyesniper2
title: Text
description:
Text is simply text, i.e. a sequence of characters, which can optionally contain expressions which will be replaced with a meaningful representation (e.g. %player% will be replaced with the player's name).
Because scripts are also text, you have to put text into double quotes to tell Skript which part of the line is an effect/expression and which part is the text.
Please read the article on Texts and Variable Names to learn more.
type_usage:
simple: "..."
quotes: "...""..."
expressions: "...%expression%..."
percent signs: "...%%..."

creator: eyesniper2
title: Region
description:
A region of a regions plugin. Skript currently supports WorldGuard, Factions, GriefPrevention and PreciousStones.
Please note that some regions plugins do not have named regions, some use numerical ids to identify regions, and some may have regions with the same name in different worlds, thus using regions like "region name" in scripts may or may not work.
type_usage: "region name"

creator: eyesniper2
title: Projectile
description: A projectile, e.g. an arrow, snowball or thrown potion.
type_usage: arrow, fireball, snowball, thrown potion, etc.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Offline Player
description: A player that is possibly offline. See player for more information. Please note that while all effects and conditions that require a player can be used with an offline player as well, they will not work if the player is not actually online.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Object
description: The supertype of all types, meaning that if %object% is used in e.g. a condition it will accept all kinds of expressions.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Money
description: A certain amount of money. Please note that this differs from numbers as it includes a currency symbol or name, but usually the two are interchangeable, e.g. you can both add 100$ to the player's balance and add 100 to the player's balance.
type_usage: <number> $ or $ <number>, where '$' is your server's currency, e.g. '10 rupees' or '£5.00'

creator: eyesniper2
title: Location
description: A location in a world. Locations are world-specific and even store a direction, e.g. if you save a location and later teleport to it you will face the exact same direction you did when you saved the location.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Slot
description:
Represents a single slot of an inventory. Notable slots are the armour slots and furnace slots. 
The most important property that distinguishes a slot from an item is its ability to be changed, e.g. it can be set, deleted, enchanted, etc. (Some item expressions can be changed as well, e.g. items stored in variables. For that matter: slots are never saved to variables, only the items they represent at the time when the variable is set).
Please note that tool can be regarded a slot, but it can actually change it's position, i.e. doesn't represent always the same slot.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Entity Type
description: The type of an entity, e.g. player, wolf, powered creeper, etc.
type_usage: Detailed usage will be added eventually

creator: eyesniper2
title: Date
description:
A date is a certain point in the real world's time which can be obtained with now expression, unix date expression and date function.
See time and timespan for the other time types of Skript.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Command Sender
description: A player or the console.
type_usage:
use the console for the console
see player for players.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Location
description:
The location of a block or entity. This not only represents the x, y and z coordinates of the location but also includes the world and the direction an entity is looking (e.g. teleporting to a saved location will make the teleported entity face the same saved direction every time).
Please note that the location of an entity is at it's feet, use head location to get the location of the head.

creator: bensku
title: Command Sender
description:
The player or the console who sent a command. Mostly useful in commands and command events.
If the command sender is a command block, its location can be retrieved by using %block's location%

creator: eyesniper2
title: Prefix/Suffix
description: The prefix or suffix as defined in the server's chat plugin.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Location
description: The location where an event happened (e.g. at an entity or block), or a location relative to another (e.g. 1 meter above another location).

creator: eyesniper2
title: Items In
description:
All items or specific type(s) of items in an inventory. Useful for looping or storing in a list variable.
Please note that the positions of the items in the inventory are not saved, only their order is preserved.
syntax_pattern:
[all [[of] the]] items ([with]in|of|contained in|out of) [inventor(y|ies)] %inventories%
all [[of] the] %itemtypes% ([with]in|of|contained in|out of) [inventor(y|ies)] %inventories%

creator: eyesniper2
title: Block
description:
The block involved in the event, e.g. the clicked block or the placed block.
Can optionally include a direction as well, e.g. 'block above' or 'block in front of the player'.

creator: bensku
title: Can Hold
description: Tests whether a player or a chest can hold the given item.
syntax_pattern:
%inventories% (can hold|ha(s|ve) [enough] space (for|to hold)) %itemtypes%
%inventories% (can(no|')t hold|(ha(s|ve) not|ha(s|ve)n't|do[es]n't have) [enough] space (for|to hold)) %itemtypes%

creator: bensku
title: Region
description:
The region involved in an event.
This expression requires a supported regions plugin to be installed.

creator: bensku
title: Parse Error
description: The error which caused the last parse operation to fail, which might not be set if a pattern was used and the pattern didn't match the provided text at all.

creator: bensku
title: Version
description: The version of Bukkit, Minecraft or Skript respectively.

creator: bensku
title: Now
description: The current system time of the server. Use time to get the Minecraft time of a world.

creator: bensku
title: Worlds
description: All worlds of the server, useful for looping.

creator: bensku
title: Vectors - Normalized
description: Returns the same vector but with length 1.

creator: bensku
title: Command
description: The command that caused an 'on command' event (excluding the leading slash and all arguments)

creator: bensku
title: Potion (item)
description: Potion in item form, with advanced parameters.
syntax_pattern:
[((regular|normal)|(strong|upgraded|level 2)|(extended|long)) ][((splash|exploding)|lingering) ]potion of %potioneffecttype%
[((regular|normal)|(strong|upgraded|level 2)|(extended|long)) ][((splash|exploding)|lingering) ]%potioneffecttype% potion
(water bottle|bottle of water)
potion

creator: bensku
title: Moved blocks
description: Blocks which are moved in a piston event. Cannot be used outside of piston events.

creator: bensku
title: Loop value
description: Returns the previous, current, or next looped value.

creator: bensku
title: Chat Recipients
description: Recipients of chat events where this is called.

creator: bensku
title: Vectors - Angle Between
description: Gets the angle between two vectors.

creator: bensku
title: Final Damage
description: How much damage is done in a damage event, considering all types of damage reduction. Can NOT be changed.

creator: bensku
title: Me
description: A 'me' expression that can be used in players' effect commands only.

creator: bensku
title: Vectors - Create from XYZ
description: Creates a vector from x, y and z values.

creator: bensku
title: Saturation
description: The saturation of a player. If used in a player event, it can be omitted and will default to event-player.

creator: bensku
title: Inventory Action
description: The inventory action of an inventory event. Please click on the link for more information.

creator: bensku
title: Shooter
description: The shooter of a projectile.

creator: bensku
title: Console
description: Represents the server's console which can receive messages and execute commands

creator: bensku
title: Item
description: The item involved in an event, e.g. in a drop, dispense, pickup or craft event.

creator: bensku
title: Tamer
description: The tamer of an entity. Can only be used in entity tame events. You can use 'event-entity' to refer tamed entity itself.

creator: bensku
title: Inventory Slot
description: Represents a slot in an inventory. It can be used to change the item in an inventory too.

creator: bensku
title: Random
description: Gets a random item out of a set, e.g. a random player out of all players online.

creator: bensku
title: Location At
description: Allows to create a location from three coordinates and a world.

creator: bensku
title: Distance
description: The distance between two points.

creator: bensku
title: Items
description: Items or blocks of a specific type, useful for looping.
syntax_pattern:
[all [[of] the]|the] block[[ ]type]s
every block[[ ]type]
[all [[of] the]|the|every] block[s] of type[s] %itemtypes%
[all [[of] the]|the|every] item[s] of type[s] %itemtypes%

creator: bensku
title: Index Of
description: The first or last index of a character (or text) in a text, or -1 if it doesn't occur in the text. Indices range from 1 to the length of the text.

creator: bensku
title: Difference
description:
The difference between two values
Supported types include numbers, dates and times.

creator: bensku
title: Regions At
description:
All regions at a particular location.
This expression requires a supported regions plugin to be installed.

creator: bensku
title: Region Members & Owners
description:
A list of members or owners of a region.
This expression requires a supported regions plugin to be installed.

creator: bensku
title: Money
description: How much virtual money a player has (can be changed). This expression requires Vault and a compatible economy plugin to be installed.

creator: bensku
title: Length
description: The length of a text, in number of characters.

creator: bensku
title: Inventory
description: The inventory of a block or player. You can usually omit this expression and can directly add or remove items to/from blocks or players.

creator: bensku
title: Gravity
description: If entity is affected by gravity or not, i.e. if it has Minecraft 1.10+ NoGravity flag.

creator: bensku
title: Vectors - Velocity
description: Gets or changes velocity of an entity.

creator: bensku
title: Level
description: The level of a player.

creator: bensku
title: Enchantment Level
description: The level of a particular enchantment on an item.
syntax_pattern:
[the] [enchant[ment]] level[s] of %enchantments% (on|of) %itemtypes%
[the] %enchantments% [enchant[ment]] level[s] (on|of) %itemtypes%
%itemtypes%'[s] %enchantments% [enchant[ment]] level[s]
%itemtypes%'[s] [enchant[ment]] level[s] of %enchantments%

creator: bensku
title: Formatted Time
description: Converts date to human-readable text format. By default, 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss z' (e.g. '2018-03-30 16:03:12 +01') will be used. For reference, see this Wikipedia article.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Is Playing Dead
description: Checks to see if an axolotl is playing dead.
syntax_pattern:
%livingentities% (is|are) playing dead
%livingentities% (isn't|is not|aren't|are not) playing dead

creator: eyesniper2
title: Is Persistent
description:
Whether entities, players, or leaves are persistent.
Persistence of entities is whether they are retained through server restarts.
Persistence of leaves is whether they should decay when not connected to a log block within 6 meters.
Persistence of players is if the player's playerdata should be saved when they leave the server. Players' persistence is reset back to 'true' when they join the server.
Passengers inherit the persistence of their vehicle, meaning a persistent zombie put on a non-persistent chicken will become non-persistent. This does not apply to players.
By default, all entities are persistent.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Is Eating
description: Whether a panda or horse type (horse, camel, donkey, llama, mule) is eating.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Is Dancing
description: Checks to see if an entity is dancing, such as allays, parrots, or piglins.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Is Charging Fireball
description: Check whether a ghast is charging a fireball.
syntax_pattern:
%livingentities% (is|are) charging [a] fireball
%livingentities% (isn't|is not|aren't|are not) charging [a] fireball

creator: eyesniper2
title: Goat Has Horns
description: Checks to see if a goat has or does not have a left, right, or both horns.
syntax_pattern:
%livingentities% (has|have) ((any|a) horn|[a] left horn[s]|[a] right horn[s]|both horns)
%livingentities% (doesn't|does not|do not|don't) have ((any|a) horn|[a] left horn[s]|[a] right horn[s]|both horns)

creator: eyesniper2
title: Entity Storage Is Full
description: Checks to see if the an entity block storage (i.e beehive) is full.
syntax_pattern:
[the] entity storage of %blocks% (is|are) full
%blocks%'[s] entity storage (is|are) full
[the] entity storage of %blocks% (isn't|is not|aren't|are not) full
%blocks%'[s] entity storage (isn't|is not|aren't|are not) full

creator: eyesniper2
title: Enderman Has Been Stared At
description:
Checks to see if an enderman has been stared at.
This will return true as long as the entity that stared at the enderman is still alive.
syntax_pattern:
%livingentities% (has|have) been stared at
%livingentities% (doesn't|does not|do not|don't) have been stared at

creator: eyesniper2
title: Can Despawn
description:
Check if an entity can despawn when the chunk they're located at is unloaded.
More information on what and when entities despawn can be found at reference.
syntax_pattern:
%livingentities% can despawn (on chunk unload|when far away)
%livingentities% (can't|cannot|can not) despawn (on chunk unload|when far away)

creator: eyesniper2
title: Camel Is Dashing
description: Checks whether a camel is currently using its dash ability.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Beehive Is Sedated
description: Checks if a beehive is sedated from a nearby campfire.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Allay Can Duplicate
description: Checks to see if an allay is able to duplicate naturally.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Periodical
description: An event that is called periodically.

creator: eyesniper2
title: On World Border Center Change
description:
Called when a world border's center has changed.
This event does not get called for virtual borders.

creator: eyesniper2
title: On World Border Bounds Finish Change
description:
Called when a moving world border has finished its move.
This event does not get called for virtual borders.
event_values: event-number, event-time span, event-world, event-worldborder, past event-number

creator: eyesniper2
title: On World Border Bounds Change
description:
Called when a world border changes its bounds, either over time, or instantly.
This event does not get called for virtual borders.
event_values: event-number, event-time span, event-world, event-worldborder, past event-number

creator: bensku
title: On Teleport
description:
This event can be used to listen to teleports from non-players or player entities respectively.
When teleporting entities, the event may also be called due to a result of natural causes, such as an enderman or shulker teleporting, or wolves teleporting to players.
When teleporting players, the event can be called by teleporting through a nether/end portal, or by other means (e.g. plugins).
event_values: event-block, event-chunk, event-command sender, event-entity, event-entity type, event-location, event-player, event-teleport cause, event-world, past event-chunk, past event-location

creator: eyesniper2
title: On System Time
description: Called when the local time of the system the server is running on reaches the provided real-life time.

creator: Blueyescat
title: On Pick Up
description: Called when a player/entity picks up an item. Please note that the item is still on the ground when this event is called.
event_values: event-command sender, event-dropped item, event-entity, event-entity type, event-item stack, event-item type, event-location, event-player, event-projectile, event-world

creator: eyesniper2
title: Seed of Loot Table
description: Returns the seed of a loot table. Setting the seed of a block or entity that does not have a loot table will not do anything.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Rotation Axis/Angle
description:
Returns the axis or angle that a quaternion will rotate by/around.
All quaternions can be represented by a rotation of some amount around some axis, so this expression provides the ability to get that angle/axis.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Rotated Quaternion/Vector
description:
Rotates a quaternion or vector around an axis a set amount of degrees, or around all 3 axes at once.
Vectors can only be rotated around the global X/Y/Z axes, or an arbitrary vector axis.
Quaternions are more flexible, allowing rotation around the global or local X/Y/Z axes, arbitrary vectors, or all 3 local axes at once.
Global axes are the ones in the Minecraft world. Local axes are relative to how the quaternion is already oriented.

Note that rotating a quaternion around a vector results in a rotation around the local vector, so results may not be what you expect. For example, rotating around vector(1, 0, 0) is the same as rotating around the local X axis.
The same applies to rotations by all three axes at once. In addition, rotating around all three axes of a quaternion/display at once will rotate in ZYX order, meaning the Z rotation will be applied first and the X rotation last.
syntax_pattern:
%quaternions/vectors% rotated around [the] [global] (x|y|z)(-| )axis by %number%
%quaternions% rotated around [the|its|their] local (x|y|z)(-| )ax(i|e)s by %number%
%quaternions/vectors% rotated around [the] %vector% by %number%
%quaternions% rotated by x %number%, y %number%(, [and]| and) z %number%

creator: eyesniper2
title: Player Input Keys
description: Get the current input keys of a player.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Named Item/Inventory
description: Directly names an item/inventory, useful for defining a named item/inventory in a script. If you want to (re)name existing items/inventories you can either use this expression or use set name of <item/inventory> to <text>.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Luck of Loot Context
description: Returns the luck of a loot context as a float. This represents the luck potion effect that an entity can have.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Love Time
description:
The amount of time the animals have been in love for. Using a value of 30 seconds is equivalent to using an item to breed them.
Only works on animals that can be bred and returns '0 seconds' for animals that can't be bred.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Looter of Loot Context
description: Returns the looter of a loot context. Note that setting the looter will read the looter's tool enchantments (e.g. looting) when generating loot.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Looted Entity of Loot Context
description: Returns the looted entity of a loot context.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Loot of Loot Table
description: Returns the items of a loot table using a loot context. Not specifying a loot context will use a loot context with a location at the world's origin.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Loot Table from Key
description: Returns the loot table from a namespaced key.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Loot Table
description:
Returns the loot table of an entity or block.
Setting the loot table of a block will update the block state, and once opened will generate loot of the specified loot table. Please note that doing so may cause warnings in the console due to over-filling the chest.
Please note that resetting/deleting the loot table of an ENTITY will reset the entity's loot table to its default.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Loot Location of Loot Context
description: Returns the loot location of a loot context.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Loot Context
description: The loot context involved in the context create section.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Item of an Entity
description:
An item associated with an entity. For dropped item entities, it gets the item that was dropped.
For item frames, the item inside the frame is returned.
For throwable projectiles (snowballs, enderpearls etc.) or item displays, it gets the displayed item.
Other entities do not have items associated with them.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Item Display Transform
description: Returns or changes the item display transform of item displays.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Furnace Times
description:
The cook time, total cook time, and burn time of a furnace. Can be changed.

- cook time: The amount of time an item has been smelting for.
- total cook time: The amount of time required to finish smelting an item.
- burn time: The amount of time left for the current fuel until consumption of another fuel item.
syntax_pattern:
[the] [furnace] cook[ing] time [of %blocks%]
%blocks%'[s]cook[ing] time
[the] [furnace] total cook[ing] time [of %blocks%]
%blocks%'[s]total cook[ing] time
[the] [furnace] fuel burn[ing] time [of %blocks%]
%blocks%'[s]fuel burn[ing] time

creator: eyesniper2
title: Furnace Event Items
description:
Represents the different items in furnace events.
Only 'smelting item' can be changed.
syntax_pattern:
[the] (smelted item|result[ item])
[the] extracted item[s]
[the] smelting item
[the] burned (fuel|item)

creator: eyesniper2
title: Fishing Wait Time
description:
Returns the minimum and/or maximum waiting time of the fishing hook. 
Default minimum value is 5 seconds and maximum is 30 seconds, before lure is applied.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Fishing Hooked Entity
description: Returns the hooked entity in the hooked event.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Fishing Hook
description: The fishing hook in a fishing event.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Fishing Bite Time
description:
Returns the time it takes a fish to bite the fishing hook, after it started approaching the hook.
May return a timespan of 0 seconds. If modifying the value, it should be at least 1 tick.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Fishing Approach Angle
description:
Returns the angle at which the fish will approach the fishing hook, after the wait time.
The angle is in degrees, with 0 being positive Z, 90 being negative X, 180 being negative Z, and 270 being positive X.
By default, returns a value between 0 and 360 degrees.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Display View Range
description:
Returns or changes the view range of displays.
Default value is 1.0. This value is then multiplied by 64 and the player's entity view distance setting to determine the actual range.
For example, a player with 150% entity view distance will see a block display with a view range of 1.2 at 1.2 * 64 * 150% = 115.2 blocks away.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Display Transformation Scale/Translation
description: Returns or changes the transformation scale or translation of displays.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Display Transformation Rotation
description:
Returns or changes the transformation rotation of displays.
The left rotation is applied first, with the right rotation then being applied based on the rotated axis.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Display Teleport Duration
description:
The teleport duration of displays is the amount of time it takes to get between locations.
0 means that updates are applied immediately.
1 means that the display entity will move from current position to the updated one over one tick.
Higher values spread the movement over multiple ticks. Max of 59 ticks.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Display Shadow Radius/Strength
description: Returns or changes the shadow radius/strength of displays.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Display Interpolation Delay/Duration
description:
Returns or changes the interpolation delay/duration of displays.
Interpolation duration is the amount of time a display will take to interpolate, or shift, between its current state and a new state.
Interpolation delay is the amount of ticks before client-side interpolation will commence.Setting to 0 seconds will make it immediate.
Resetting either value will return that value to 0.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Display Height/Width
description:
Returns or changes the height or width of displays.
The rendering culling bounding box spans horizontally width/2 from entity position, which determines the point at which the display will be frustum culled (no longer rendered because the game determines you are no longer able to see it).
If set to 0, no culling will occur on both the vertical and horizontal directions. Default is 0.0.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Display Glow Color Override
description:
Returns or changes the glowing color override of displays.
This overrides whatever color is already set for the scoreboard team of the displays.
syntax_pattern:
[the] glow[ing] colo[u]r[s] override[s] [of %displays%]
%displays%'[s] glow[ing] colo[u]r[s] override[s]

creator: eyesniper2
title: Display Brightness
description:
Returns or changes the brightness override of displays.
Unmodified displays will not have a brightness override value set. Resetting or deleting this value will remove the override.
Use the 'block' or 'sky' options to get/change specific values or get both values as a list by using neither option.
NOTE: setting only one of the sky/block light overrides of a display without an existing override will set both sky and block light to the given value. Make sure to set both block and sky levels to your desired values for the best results. Likewise, you can only clear the brightness override, you cannot clear/reset the sky/block values individually.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Display Billboard
description:
Returns or changes the billboard setting of displays.
This describes the axes/points around which the display can pivot.
Displays spawn with the 'fixed' billboard by default. Resetting this expression will also set it to 'fixed'.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Create Loot Context
description: Create a loot context.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Breeding Family
description: Represents family members within a breeding event.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Text Display See Through Blocks
description: Forces a text display to either be or not be visible through blocks.
syntax_pattern:
make %displays% visible through (blocks|walls)
force %displays% to be visible through (blocks|walls)
(prevent|block) %displays% from being (visible|seen) through (blocks|walls)

creator: eyesniper2
title: Text Display Drop Shadow
description: Applies or removes drop shadow from the displayed text on a text display.
syntax_pattern:
(apply|add) (drop|text) shadow to [[the] text of] %displays%
(apply|add) (drop|text) shadow to %displays%'[s] text
(remove|clear) (drop|text) shadow from [[the] text of] %displays%
(remove|clear) (drop|text) shadow from %displays%'[s] text

creator: eyesniper2
title: Rotate
description:
Rotates displays, quaternions, or vectors around an axis a set amount of degrees, or around all 3 axes at once.
Vectors can only be rotated around the global X/Y/Z axes, or an arbitrary vector axis.
Quaternions are more flexible, allowing rotation around the global or local X/Y/Z axes, arbitrary vectors, or all 3 local axes at once.
Global axes are the ones in the Minecraft world. Local axes are relative to how the quaternion is already oriented.

Rotating a display is a shortcut for rotating its left rotation. If the right rotation needs to be modified, it should be acquired, rotated, and re-set.

Note that rotating a quaternion/display around a vector results in a rotation around the local vector, so results may not be what you expect. For example, rotating quaternions/displays around vector(1, 0, 0) is the same as rotating around the local X axis.
The same applies to rotations by all three axes at once. In addition, rotating around all three axes of a quaternion/display at once will rotate in ZYX order, meaning the Z rotation will be applied first and the X rotation last.
syntax_pattern:
rotate %vectors/quaternions/displays% around [the] [global] (x|y|z)(-| )axis by %number%
rotate %quaternions/displays% around [the|its|their] local (x|y|z)(-| )ax(i|e)s by %number%
rotate %vectors/quaternions/displays% around [the] %vector% by %number%
rotate %quaternions/displays% by x %number%, y %number%(, [and]| and) z %number%

creator: eyesniper2
title: Pull In Hooked Entity
description: Pull the hooked entity to the player.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Make Breedable
description: Sets whether or not entities will be able to breed. Only works on animals.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Make Adult/Baby
description: Force a animal to become an adult or baby.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Generate Loot
description:
Generates the loot in the specified inventories from a loot table using a loot context. Not specifying a loot context will use a loot context with a location at the world's origin.
Note that if the inventory is full, it will cause warnings in the console due to over-filling the inventory.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Apply Fishing Lure
description: Sets whether the lure enchantment should be applied, which reduces the wait time.
syntax_pattern:
apply [the] lure enchantment bonus
remove [the] lure enchantment bonus

creator: eyesniper2
title: Allow Aging
description: Sets whether or not living entities will be able to age.
syntax_pattern:
lock age of %livingentities%
prevent aging of %livingentities%
prevent %livingentities% from aging
unlock age of %livingentities%
allow aging of %livingentities%
allow %livingentities% to age

creator: eyesniper2
title: Text Display Visible Through Blocks
description: Returns whether text displays can be seen through blocks or not.
syntax_pattern:
%displays% (is|are) visible through (blocks|walls)
%displays% (isn't|is not|aren't|are not) visible through (blocks|walls)

creator: eyesniper2
title: Text Display Has Drop Shadow
description: Returns whether the text of a display has drop shadow applied.
syntax_pattern:
[[the] text of] %displays% (has|have) [a] (drop|text) shadow
%displays%'[s] text (has|have) [a] (drop|text) shadow
[[the] text of] %displays% (doesn't|does not|do not|don't) have [a] (drop|text) shadow
%displays%'[s] text (doesn't|does not|do not|don't) have [a] (drop|text) shadow

creator: eyesniper2
title: Is Tagged
description: Checks whether an item, block, entity, or entitydata is tagged with the given tag.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Is Pressing Key
description: Checks if a player is pressing a certain input key.
syntax_pattern:
%players% (is|are) pressing %inputkeys%
%players% (isn't|is not|aren't|are not) pressing %inputkeys%
%players% (was|were) pressing %inputkeys%
%players% (wasn't|was not|weren't|were not) pressing %inputkeys%

creator: eyesniper2
title: Is Lootable
description: Checks whether an entity or block is lootable. Lootables are entities or blocks that can have a loot table.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Is In Love
description: Checks whether or not a living entity is in love.
syntax_pattern:
%livingentities% (is|are) in lov(e|ing) [state|mode]
%livingentities% (isn't|is not|aren't|are not) in lov(e|ing) [state|mode]

creator: eyesniper2
title: Is Fish Hook in Open Water
description:
Checks whether the fish hook is in open water.
Open water is defined by a 5x4x5 area of water, air and lily pads. If in open water, treasure items may be caught.
syntax_pattern:
%entities% (is|are) in open water[s]
%entities% (isn't|is not|aren't|are not) in open water[s]

creator: eyesniper2
title: Is Baby
description: Checks whether or not a living entity is a baby.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Is Adult
description: Checks whether or not a living entity is an adult.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Has Loot Table
description: Checks whether an entity or block has a loot table. The loot tables of chests will be deleted when the chest is opened or broken.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Fishing Lure Applied
description: Checks if the lure enchantment is applied to the current fishing event.
syntax_pattern:
lure enchantment bonus is (applied|active)
lure enchantment bonus is(n't| not) (applied|active)

creator: eyesniper2
title: Can Breed
description: Checks whether or not a living entity can be bred.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Can Age
description: Checks whether or not an entity will be able to age/grow up.

creator: eyesniper2
title: On Start Smelt
description: Called when a furnace starts smelting an item in its ore slot.

creator: bensku
title: On Fuel Burn
description: Called when a furnace burns an item from its fuel slot.

creator: bensku
title: On Fishing
description:
Called when a player triggers a fishing event.
An entity hooked event is triggered when an entity gets caught by a fishing rod.
A fish escape event is called when the player fails to click on time, and the fish escapes.
A fish approaching event is when the bobber is waiting to be hooked, and a fish is approaching.
A fishing state change event is triggered whenever the fishing state changes.
syntax_pattern:
[on] [fishing] (line|rod) cast
[on] fish (caught|catch)
[on] entity (hook[ed]|caught|catch)
[on] (bobber|hook) (in|hit) ground
[on] fish (escape|get away)
[on] [fishing] (rod|line) reel in
[on] fish bit(e|ing)
[on] (fish approach[ing]|(bobber|hook) lure[d])
[on] fishing state change[d]
event_values: event-entity, event-fishing state, event-player, event-projectile, event-world

creator: eyesniper2
title: On Entity Breed
description: Called whenever two animals begin to conceive a child. The type can be specified.
event_values: event-command sender, event-entity, event-entity type, event-item stack, event-location, event-world

creator: eyesniper2
title: Wolf Variant
description:
Represents the variant of a wolf entity.
NOTE: Minecraft namespaces are supported, ex: 'minecraft:ashen'.
type_usage: ashen, black, chestnut, pale, rusty, snowy, spotted, striped, woods

creator: eyesniper2
title: Firework Type
description: The type of a fireworkeffect.
type_usage: small, ball, star shaped, large, star, creeper face, small ball, large ball, burst, ball large, creeper

creator: eyesniper2
title: Cat Type
description:
Represents the race/type of a cat entity.
NOTE: Minecraft namespaces are supported, ex: 'minecraft:british_shorthair'.
type_usage: all black, black, british shorthair, calico, jellie, persian, ragdoll, red, siamese, tabby, white

creator: eyesniper2
title: Any Valued Thing
description: Something that has a value.

creator: bensku
title: Vectors - Vector from Yaw and Pitch
description: Creates a vector from a yaw and pitch value.
syntax_pattern:
[a] [new] vector (from|with) yaw %number% and pitch %number%
[a] [new] vector (from|with) pitch %number% and yaw %number%

creator: eyesniper2
title: Value
description:
Returns the value of something that has a value, e.g. a node in a config.
The value is automatically converted to the specified type (e.g. text, number) where possible.
syntax_pattern:
[the] %*classinfo% value [at] %string% (from|in) %node%
[the] %*classinfo% value of %valued%
[the] %*classinfo% values of %valueds%
%valued%'s %*classinfo% value
%valueds%'[s] %*classinfo% values

creator: bensku
title: Type of
description:
Type of a block, item, entity, inventory, potion effect or enchantment type.
Types of items, blocks and block datas are item types similar to them but have amounts
of one, no display names and, on Minecraft 1.13 and newer versions, are undamaged.
Types of entities and inventories are entity types and inventory types known to Skript.
Types of potion effects are potion effect types.
Types of enchantment types are enchantments.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Queue (Experimental)
description:
Requires the using queues experimental feature flag to be enabled.

Creates a new queue.
A queue is a set of elements that can have things removed from the start and added to the end.

Any value can be added to a queue. Adding a non-existent value (e.g. `{variable that isn't set}`) will have no effect.
This means that removing an element from the queue will always return a value unless the queue is empty.

Requesting an element from a queue (e.g. `the 1st element of {queue}`) also removes it from the queue.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Spawn
description:
Spawns entities. This can be used as an effect and as a section.

If it is used as a section, the section is run before the entity is added to the world.
You can modify the entity in this section, using for example 'event-entity' or 'cow'. 
Do note that other event values, such as 'player', won't work in this section.

If you're spawning a display and want it to be empty on initialization, like not having a block display be stone, set hidden config node 'spawn empty displays' to true.

Note that when spawning an entity via entity snapshots, the code within the section will not run instantaneously as compared to spawning normally (via 'a zombie').

creator: eyesniper2
title: Shoot
description: Shoots a projectile (or any other entity) from a given entity or location.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Loop
description:
Loop sections repeat their code with multiple values.

A loop will loop through all elements of the given expression, e.g. all players, worlds, items, etc. The conditions & effects inside the loop will be executed for every of those elements, which can be accessed with ‘loop-’, e.g. send "hello" to loop-player. When a condition inside a loop is not fulfilled the loop will start over with the next element of the loop. You can however use stop loop to exit the loop completely and resume code execution after the end of the loop.

Loopable Values
All expressions that represent more than one value, e.g. ‘all players’, ‘worlds’, etc., as well as list variables, can be looped. You can also use a list of expressions, e.g. loop the victim and the attacker, to execute the same code for only a few values.

List Variables
When looping list variables, you can also use loop-index in addition to loop-value inside the loop. loop-value is the value of the currently looped variable, and loop-index is the last part of the variable's name (the part where the list variable has its asterisk *).

creator: eyesniper2
title: For Each Loop (Experimental)
description:
A specialised loop section run for each element in a list.
Unlike the basic loop, this is designed for extracting the key & value from pairs.
The loop element's key/index and value can be stored in a variable for convenience.

When looping a simple (non-indexed) set of values, e.g. all players, the index will be the loop counter number.

creator: Blueyescat
title: rgb
description: Returns a RGB color from the given red, green and blue parameters. Alpha values can be added optionally, but these only take affect in certain situations, like text display backgrounds.
