<number> [minecraft/mc/real/rl/irl] ticks/seconds/minutes/hours/days/weeks/months/years [[,/and] <more...>]
[###:]##:##[.####] ([hours:]minutes:seconds[.milliseconds])

creator: eyesniper2
title: Player
description:
A player. Depending on whether a player is online or offline several actions can be performed with them, though you won't get any errors when using effects that only work if the player is online (e.g. changing their inventory) on an offline player.
You have two possibilities to use players as command arguments: <player> and <offline player>. The first requires that the player is online and also accepts only part of the name, while the latter doesn't require that the player is online, but the player's name has to be entered exactly.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Item Type
description:
An item type is an alias that can result in different items when added to an inventory, and unlike items they are well suited for checking whether an inventory contains a certain item or whether a certain item is of a certain type.
An item type can also have one or more enchantments with or without a specific level defined, and can optionally start with 'all' or 'every' to make this item type represent all types that the alias represents, including data ranges.
type_usage: [<number> [of]] [all/every] <alias> [of <enchantment> [<level>] [,/and <more enchantments...>]]

creator: Blueyescat
title: Firework Effect
description:
A configuration of effects that defines the firework when exploded
which can be used in the launch firework effect.
See the firework effect expression for detailed patterns.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Experience
description: Experience points. Please note that Bukkit only allows to give XP, but not remove XP from players. You can however change a player's level and level progress freely.
type_usage: [<number>] ([e]xp|experience [point[s]])

creator: Blueyescat
title: Entity Type with Amount
description: An entity type with an amount, e.g. '2 zombies'. I might remove this type in the future and make a more general 'type' type, i.e. a type that has a number and a type.
type_usage: <number> <entity type>

creator: HYPExMon5ter
title: Enchantment Type
description: An enchantment with an optional level, e.g. 'sharpness 2' or 'fortune'.
type_usage: <enchantment> [<level>]

creator: eyesniper2
title: View Distance of Client
description: The view distance of the client. Can not be changed. This differs from the server side view distance of player as this will retrieve the view distance the player has set on their client.
syntax_pattern:
[the] client view distance[s] of %players%
%players%'[s] client view distance[s]

creator: bensku
title: Tool
description: The item an entity is holding in their main or off hand.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Protocol Version
description:
The protocol version that will be sent as the protocol version of the server in a server list ping event. For more information and list of protocol versions visit wiki.vg.
If this protocol version doesn't match with the protocol version of the client, the client will see the version string.
But please note that, this expression has no visual effect over the version string. For example if the server uses PaperSpigot 1.12.2, and you make the protocol version 107 (1.9),
the version string will not be "Paper 1.9", it will still be "Paper 1.12.2".
But then you can customize the version string as you wish.
Also if the protocol version of the player is higher than protocol version of the server, it will say
"Server out of date!", and if vice-versa "Client out of date!" when you hover on the ping bars.

This can be set in a server list ping event only
(increase and decrease effects cannot be used because that wouldn't make sense).

creator: eyesniper2
title: Plain Item
description: A plain item is an item with no modifications. It can be used to convert items to their default state or to match with other default items.

creator: bensku
title: Maximum Stack Size
description:
The maximum stack size of an item (e.g. 64 for torches, 16 for buckets, 1 for swords, etc.) or inventory.
In 1.20.5+, the maximum stack size of items can be changed to any integer from 1 to 99, and stacked up to the maximum stack size of the inventory they're in.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Max Players
description:
The count of max players. This can be changed in a server list ping event only.
'real max players' returns the real count of max players of the server and can be modified on Paper 1.16 or later.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Last Color
description: The colors used at the end of a string. The colors of the returned string will be formatted with their symbols.

creator: bensku
title: Id
description: The id of a specific item. You usually don't need this expression as you can likely do everything with aliases.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Firework Effect
description: Represents a 'firework effect' which can be used in the launch firework effect.
syntax_pattern:
(|flickering|trailing|flickering trailing|trailing flickering) %fireworktype% [firework [effect]] colo[u]red %colors%
(|flickering|trailing|flickering trailing|trailing flickering) %fireworktype% [firework [effect]] colo[u]red %colors% fad(e|ing) [to] %colors%

creator: eyesniper2
title: Enchanting Experience Cost
description:
The cost of enchanting in an enchant event.
This is number that was displayed in the enchantment table, not the actual number of levels removed.

creator: bensku
title: Damage Value/Durability
description: The damage value/durability of an item.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Burn/Cook Time
description:
The time a furnace takes to burn an item in a fuel burn event.
Can also be used to change the burn/cook time of a placed furnace.

creator: bensku
title: Potion Effects
description: Apply or remove potion effects to/from entities.
syntax_pattern:
apply %potioneffects% to %livingentities%
apply infinite [ambient] [potion of] %potioneffecttypes% [potion] [[[of] tier] %number%] [without [any] particles] [(whilst hiding [the]|without (the|a)) [potion] icon] to %livingentities% [replacing [the] existing effect]
apply [ambient] [potion of] %potioneffecttypes% [potion] [[[of] tier] %number%] [without [any] particles] [(whilst hiding [the]|without (the|a)) [potion] icon] to %livingentities% [for %timespan%] [replacing [the] existing effect]
compatible_addon_version: 2.0, 2.2-dev27 (ambient and particle-less potion effects), 2.5 (replacing existing effect), 2.5.2 (potion effects), 2.7 (icon and infinite)

creator: Blueyescat
title: Gene
description: Represents a Panda's main or hidden gene. See genetics for more info.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Resource Pack
description: Checks state of the resource pack in a resource pack request response event.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Is Block
description: Checks whether an item is a block.

creator: Blueyescat
title: All Permissions
description: Returns all permissions of the defined player(s). Note that the modifications to resulting list do not actually change permissions.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Is Alive
description: Checks whether an entity is alive. Works for non-living entities too.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Sound Category
description: The category of a sound, they are used for sound options of Minecraft. See the play sound and stop sound effects.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Resource Pack State
description: The state in a resource pack request response event.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Player List Header and Footer
description: The message above and below the player list in the tab menu.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Last Resource Pack Response
description: Returns the last resource pack response received from a player.
syntax_pattern:
[the] [last] resource pack response[s] of %players%
%players%'[s] [last] resource pack response[s]

creator: eyesniper2
title: Vehicle
description: Represents a vehicle.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Blocks
description:
Blocks relative to other blocks or between other blocks.
Can be used to get blocks relative to other blocks or for looping.
Blocks from/to and between will return a straight line whereas blocks within will return a cuboid.
syntax_pattern:
[(all [[of] the]|the)] blocks %direction% [%locations%]
[(all [[of] the]|the)] blocks from %location% [on] %direction%
[(all [[of] the]|the)] blocks from %location% to %location%
[(all [[of] the]|the)] blocks between %location% and %location%
[(all [[of] the]|the)] blocks within %location% and %location%
[(all [[of] the]|the)] blocks (in|within) %chunk%

creator: Blueyescat
title: Connect
description:
Connect a player to a server running on your proxy, or any server supporting transfers. Read below for more information.
If the server is running Minecraft 1.20.5 or above, you may specify an IP and Port to transfer a player over to that server.
When transferring players using an IP, the transfer will not complete if the `accepts-transfers` option isn't enabled in `server.properties` for the server specified.
If the port is not provided, it will default to `25565`.
syntax_pattern:
connect %players% to [proxy|bungeecord] [server] %string%
send %players% to [proxy|bungeecord] server %string%
transfer %players% to server %string% [on port %number%]

creator: eyesniper2
title: Text Of
description:
Returns or changes the text/string of displays.
Note that currently you can only use Skript chat codes when running Paper.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Text Display Opacity
description:
Returns or changes the opacity of text displays.
Values are between -127 and 127. The value of 127 represents it being completely opaque.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Text Display Line Width
description: Returns or changes the line width of text displays. Default is 200.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Text Display Alignment
description: Returns or changes the alignment setting of text displays.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Tags of X
description:
Returns all the tags of an item, block, or entity.
`minecraft tag` will return only the vanilla tags, `datapack tag` will return only datapack-provided tags, `paper tag` will return only Paper's custom tags (if you are running Paper), and `custom tag` will look in the "skript" namespace for custom tags you've registered.
You can also filter by tag types using "item", "block", or "entity".

creator: eyesniper2
title: Tags Contents
description:
Returns all the values that a tag contains.
For item and block tags, this will return items. For entity tags, it will return entity datas (a creeper, a zombie).

creator: eyesniper2
title: Tag Namespaced Key
description: The namespaced key of a minecraft tag. This takes the form of "namespace:key", e.g. "minecraft:dirt".

creator: Blueyescat
title: Indices of List
syntax_pattern:
[(the|all [[of] the])] (indexes|indices) of %objects%
%objects%'[s] (indexes|indices)
[sorted] (indices|indexes) of %objects% in (ascending|descending) order
[sorted] %objects%'[s] (indices|indexes) in (ascending|descending) order

creator: Blueyescat
title: Damaged Item
description: Directly damages an item. In MC versions 1.12.2 and lower, this can be used to apply data values to items/blocks

creator: Blueyescat
title: Cooldown Time/Remaining Time/Elapsed Time/Last Usage/Bypass Permission
description:
Only usable in command events. Represents the cooldown time, the remaining time, the elapsed time,
the last usage date, or the cooldown bypass permission.
syntax_pattern:
[the] remaining [time] [of [the] (cooldown|wait) [(of|for) [the] [current] command]]
[the] elapsed [time] [of [the] (cooldown|wait) [(of|for) [the] [current] command]]
[the] ((cooldown|wait) time|[wait] time of [the] (cooldown|wait) [(of|for) [the] [current] command])
[the] last usage [date] [of [the] (cooldown|wait) [(of|for) [the] [current] command]]
[the] [cooldown] bypass perm[ission] [of [the] (cooldown|wait) [(of|for) [the] [current] command]]

creator: Blueyescat
title: Affected Entities
description: The affected entities in the area cloud effect event.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Send Resource Pack
description:
Request that the player's client download and switch resource packs. The client will download 
the resource pack in the background, and will automatically switch to it once the download is complete. 
The URL must be a direct download link.

The hash is used for caching, the player won't have to re-download the resource pack that way. 
The hash must be SHA-1, you can get SHA-1 hash of your resource pack using 
this online tool.

The resource pack request action can be used to check 
status of the sent resource pack request.
syntax_pattern:
send [the] resource pack [from [[the] URL]] %string% to %players%
send [the] resource pack [from [[the] URL]] %string% with hash %string% to %players%

creator: eyesniper2
title: Raw Name
description: The raw Minecraft material name of the given item. Note that this is not guaranteed to give same results on all servers.

creator: bensku
title: Damage Cause
description: The damage cause of a damage event. Please click on the link for more information.

creator: eyesniper2
title: ceiling
description: Alias of ceil.

creator: eyesniper2
title: calcExperience
description: Calculates the total amount of experience needed to achieve given level from scratch in Minecraft.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Difficulty
description: The difficulty of a world.

creator: bensku
title: Speed
description:
A player's walking or flying speed. Both can be changed, but values must be between -1 and 1 (excessive values will be changed to -1 or 1 respectively). Negative values reverse directions.
Please note that changing a player's speed will change their FOV just like potions do.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Hover List
description:
The list when you hover on the player counts of the server in the server list.
This can be changed using texts or players in a server list ping event only. Adding players to the list means adding the name of the players.
And note that, for example if there are 5 online players (includes fake online count) in the server and the hover list is set to 3 values, Minecraft will show "... and 2 more ..." at end of the list.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Group
description: The primary group or all groups of a player. This expression requires Vault and a compatible permissions plugin to be installed.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Difficulty
description: The difficulty of a world.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Title - Reset
description: Resets the title of the player to the default values.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Is Swimming
description: Checks whether a living entity is swimming.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Teleport Cause
description: The teleport cause in a teleport event.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Spawn Reason
description: The spawn reason in a spawn event.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Server Icon
description: A server icon that was loaded using the load server icon effect.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Living Entity
description: A living entity, i.e. a mob or player, not inanimate entities like projectiles or dropped items.
type_usage: see entity, but ignore inanimate objects

creator: Blueyescat
title: Spawn Reason
description: The spawn reason in a spawn event.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Online Player Count
description:
The amount of online players. This can be changed in a server list ping event only to show fake online player amount.
real online player count always return the real count of online players and can't be changed.

creator: Blueyescat
title: MOTD
description:
The message of the day in the server list. This can be changed in a server list ping event only.
'default MOTD' returns the default MOTD always and can't be changed.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Leash Holder
description: The leash holder of a living entity.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Last Loaded Server Icon
description: Returns the last loaded server icon with the load server icon effect.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Item with Lore
description:
Returns the given item type with the specified lore added to it.
If multiple strings are passed, each of them will be a separate line in the lore.

creator: bensku
title: Creature/Entity/Player/Projectile/Villager/Powered Creeper/etc.
description:
The entity involved in an event (an entity is a player, a creature or an inanimate object like ignited TNT, a dropped item or an arrow).
You can use the specific type of the entity that's involved in the event, e.g. in a 'death of a creeper' event you can use 'the creeper' instead of 'the entity'.

creator: bensku
title: Chat Format
description: Can be used to get/retrieve the chat format. The sender of a message is represented by [player] or [sender], and the message by [message] or [msg].

creator: bensku
title: Block Sphere
description: All blocks in a sphere around a center, mostly useful for looping.
syntax_pattern:
[(all [[of] the]|the)] blocks in radius %number% [(of|around) %location%]
[(all [[of] the]|the)] blocks around %location% in radius %number%

creator: bensku
title: Biome
description:
The biome at a certain location. Please note that biomes are only defined for x/z-columns
(i.e. the altitude (y-coordinate) doesn't matter), up until Minecraft 1.15.x.
As of Minecraft 1.16, biomes are now 3D (per block vs column).

creator: bensku
title: Attacked
description: The victim of a damage event, e.g. when a player attacks a zombie this expression represents the zombie. When using Minecraft 1.11+, this also covers the hit entity in a projectile hit event.

creator: bensku
title: Amount of Items
description: Counts how many of a particular item type are in a given inventory.

creator: bensku
title: Alphabetical Sort
description: Sorts given strings in alphabetical order.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Toggle Flight
description: Toggle the flight mode of a player.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Player Info Visibility
description:
Sets whether all player related information is hidden in the server list.
The Vanilla Minecraft client will display ??? (dark gray) instead of player counts and will not show the
hover hist when hiding player info.
The version string can override the ???.
Also the Online Players Count and
Max Players expressions will return -1 when hiding player info.
syntax_pattern:
hide [all] player [related] info[rmation] [(in|on|from) [the] server list]
(show|reveal) [all] player [related] info[rmation] [(in|to|on|from) [the] server list]

creator: Blueyescat
title: Load Server Icon
description:
Loads server icons from the given files. You can get the loaded icon using the
last loaded server icon expression.
Please note that the image must be 64x64 and the file path starts from the server folder.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Leash entities
description:
Leash living entities to other entities. When trying to leash an Ender Dragon, Wither, Player, or a Bat, this effect will not work.
See Spigot's Javadocs for more info.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Do If
description: Execute an effect if a condition is true.

creator: bensku
title: Broadcast
description: Broadcasts a message to the server.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Action Bar
description: Sends an action bar message to the given player(s).

creator: Blueyescat
title: Starts/Ends With
description: Checks if a text starts or ends with another.

creator: bensku
title: Region Contains
description:
Checks whether a location is contained in a particular region.
This condition requires a supported regions plugin to be installed.
syntax_pattern:
[[the] region] %regions% contain[s] %directions% %locations%
%locations% (is|are) ([contained] in|part of) [[the] region] %regions%
[[the] region] %regions% (do|does)(n't| not) contain %directions% %locations%
%locations% (is|are)(n't| not) (contained in|part of) [[the] region] %regions%

creator: Blueyescat
title: Is Slime Chunk
description:
Tests whether a chunk is a so-called slime chunk.
Slimes can generally spawn in the swamp biome and in slime chunks.
For more info, see the Minecraft wiki.
syntax_pattern:
%chunk% (is|are) ([a] slime chunk|slime chunks|slimey)
%chunk% (isn't|is not|aren't|are not) ([a] slime chunk|slime chunks|slimey)

creator: Blueyescat
title: Has Scoreboard Tag
description: Checks whether the given entities has the given scoreboard tags.
syntax_pattern:
%entities% (has|have) [the] score[ ]board tag[s] %strings%
%entities% (doesn't|does not|do not|don't) have [the] score[ ]board tag[s] %strings%

creator: bensku
title: Has Permission
description: Test whether a player has a certain permission.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Has Client Weather
description: Checks whether the given players have a custom client weather

creator: bensku
title: Damage Cause
description: Tests what kind of damage caused a damage event. Refer to the Damage Cause type for a list of all possible causes.

creator: bensku
title: Chance
description:
A condition that randomly succeeds or fails.
Valid values are between 0% and 100%, or if the percent sign is omitted between 0 and 1.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Can Fly
description: Whether a player is allowed to fly.

creator: bensku
title: Can Build
description:
Tests whether a player is allowed to build at a certain location.
This condition requires a supported regions plugin to be installed.
syntax_pattern:
%players% (can|(is|are) allowed to) build %directions% %locations%
%players% (can('t|not)|(is|are)(n't| not) allowed to) build %directions% %locations%

creator: eyesniper2
title: Location
description: The location where an event happened (e.g. at an entity or block), or a location relative to another (e.g. 1 meter above another location).

creator: eyesniper2
title: Language
description:
Currently selected game language of a player. The value of the language is not defined properly.
The vanilla Minecraft client will use lowercase language / country pairs separated by an underscore, but custom resource packs may use any format they wish.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Indices of List
description: Gets indices of a list variable.

creator: bensku
title: Blocks in Region
description:
All blocks in a region.
This expression requires a supported regions plugin to be installed.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Make Say
description: Forces a player to send a message to the chat. If the message starts with a slash it will force the player to use command.

creator: bensku
title: Vectors - Dot Product
description: Gets the dot product between two vectors.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Metadata Holder
description: Something that can hold metadata (e.g. an entity or block)

creator: Blueyescat
title: Ternary
description: A shorthand expression for returning something based on a condition.

creator: Blueyescat
title: TPS (ticks per second)
description: Returns the 3 most recent TPS readings, like the /tps command. This expression is only supported on some server software (PaperSpigot).
syntax_pattern:
tps from [the] last ([1] minute|1[ ]m[inute])
tps from [the] last 5[ ]m[inutes]
tps from [the] last 15[ ]m[inutes]
[the] tps

creator: Blueyescat
title: Metadata
description: Metadata is a way to store temporary data on entities, blocks and more that disappears after a server restart.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Item Enchantments
description: All the enchantments an item type has.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Input
description:
Represents the input in a filter expression or sort effect.
For example, if you ran 'broadcast "something" and "something else" where [input is "something"]
the condition would be checked twice, using "something" and "something else" as the inputs.
The 'input index' pattern can be used when acting on a variable to access the index of the input.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Default Value
description: A shorthand expression for giving things a default value. If the first thing isn't set, the second thing will be returned.

creator: Blueyescat
title: All Groups
description: All the groups a player can have. This expression requires Vault and a compatible permissions plugin to be installed.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Starts/Ends With
description: Checks if a text starts or ends with another.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Is Transparent
description: Checks whether an item is transparent. Note that this condition may not work for all blocks, due to the transparency list used by Spigot not being completely accurate.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Is Solid
description: Checks whether an item is solid.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Is Flammable
description: Checks whether an item is flammable.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Is Edible
description: Checks whether an item is edible.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Has Metadata
description: Checks whether a metadata holder has a metadata tag.

creator: Blueyescat
title: Event Cancelled
description: Checks whether or not the event is cancelled.
syntax_pattern:
[the] event is cancel[l]ed
[the] event (is not|isn't) cancel[l]ed

creator: eyesniper2
title: Shuffled List
description: Shuffles given list randomly. This is done by replacing indices by random numbers in resulting list.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Respawn location
description: The location that a player should respawn at. This is used within the respawn event.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Player Weather
description: The weather for a player.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Opened Inventory
description:
Return the currently opened inventory of a player.
If no inventory is open, it returns the own player's crafting inventory.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Offline players
description: All players that have ever joined the server. This includes the players currently online.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Humidity
description: Humidity of given blocks.

creator: eyesniper2
title: world
description: Gets a world from its name.

creator: eyesniper2
title: vector
description: Creates a new vector, which can be used with various expressions, effects and functions.
syntax_pattern: vector(x: number, y: number, z: number)

creator: eyesniper2
title: tan
description: The tangent function. This is basically sin(arg)/cos(arg). Uses degrees, not radians.

creator: eyesniper2
title: sum
description: Sums a list of numbers.

creator: eyesniper2
title: sqrt
description:
The square root, which is the inverse operation to squaring a number (for positive numbers only). This is the same as (argument) ^ (1/2) – other roots can be calculated via number ^ (1/root), e.g. set {_l} to {_volume}^(1/3).
Returns NaN (not a number) if the argument is negative.

creator: eyesniper2
title: sin
description: The sine function. It starts at 0° with a value of 0, goes to 1 at 90°, back to 0 at 180°, to -1 at 270° and then repeats every 360°. Uses degrees, not radians.

creator: eyesniper2
title: round
description: Rounds a number, i.e. returns the closest integer to the argument. Place a second argument to define the decimal placement.

creator: eyesniper2
title: product
description: Calculates the product of a list of numbers.

creator: eyesniper2
title: mod
description:
Returns the modulo of the given arguments, i.e. the remainder of the division d/m, where d and m are the arguments of this function.
The returned value is always positive. Returns NaN (not a number) if the second argument is zero.

creator: eyesniper2
title: min
description: Returns the minimum number from a list of numbers.

creator: eyesniper2
title: max
description: Returns the maximum number from a list of numbers.

creator: eyesniper2
title: ln
description:
The natural logarithm. You probably don't need this if you don't know what this is.
Returns NaN (not a number) if the argument is negative.

creator: eyesniper2
title: floor
description: Rounds a number down, i.e. returns the closest integer smaller than or equal to the argument.

creator: eyesniper2
title: exp
description: The exponential function. You probably don't need this if you don't know what this is.

creator: eyesniper2
title: cos
description: The cosine function. This is basically the sine shifted by 90°, i.e. cos(a) = sin(a + 90°), for any number a. Uses degrees, not radians.

creator: eyesniper2
title: atan2
description:
Similar to atan, but requires two coordinates and returns values from -180 to 180.
The returned angle is measured counterclockwise in a standard mathematical coordinate system (x to the right, y to the top).

creator: eyesniper2
title: atan
description: The inverse of the tangent, also called arctan. Returns result in degrees, not radians. Only returns values from -90 to 90.

creator: eyesniper2
title: asin
description: The inverse of the sine, also called arcsin. Returns result in degrees, not radians. Only returns values from -90 to 90.

creator: eyesniper2
title: acos
description: The inverse of the cosine, also called arccos. Returns result in degrees, not radians. Only returns values from 0 to 180.

creator: eyesniper2
title: abs
description: Returns the absolute value of the argument, i.e. makes the argument positive.

creator: bensku
title: Time
description:
The time of a world.
Use the "minecraft timespan" syntax to change the time according to Minecraft's time intervals.
Since Minecraft uses discrete intervals for time (ticks), changing the time by real-world minutes or real-world seconds only changes it approximately.
Removing an amount of time from a world's time will move the clock forward a day.

creator: bensku
title: Item Amount
description: The amount of an item stack.

creator: bensku
title: Health
description: The health of a creature, e.g. a player, mob, villager, etc. The minimum value is 0, and the maximum is the creature's max health (e.g. 10 for players).

creator: bensku
title: Game Mode
description: The gamemode of a player. (Gamemodes)

creator: bensku
title: Passenger
description:
The passenger of a vehicle, or the rider of a mob.
For 1.11.2 and above, it returns a list of passengers and you can use all changers in it.
See also: vehicle

creator: bensku
title: Facing
description: The facing of an entity or block, i.e. exactly north, south, east, west, up or down (unlike direction which is the exact direction, e.g. '0.5 south and 0.7 east')

creator: bensku
title: Compass Target
description:
The location a player's compass is pointing at.
As of Minecraft 1.21.4, the compass is controlled by the resource pack and by default will not point to this compass target when used outside of the overworld dimension.

creator: bensku
title: IP
description: The IP address of a player, or the connected player in a connect event, or the pinger in a server list ping event.
compatible_addon_version: 1.4, 2.2-dev26 (when used in connect event), 2.3 (when used in server list ping event)

creator: bensku
title: Food Level
description: The food level of a player from 0 to 10. Has several aliases: food/hunger level/meter/bar.

creator: bensku
title: Max Health
description: The maximum health of an entity, e.g. 10 for a player.

creator: bensku
title: Remaining Air
description: How much time a player has left underwater before starting to drown.

creator: bensku
title: Book Title
description: The title of a book.

creator: bensku
title: Head location
description:
The location of an entity's head, mostly useful for players and e.g. looping blocks in the player's line of sight.
Please note that this location is only accurate for entities whose head is exactly above their center, i.e. players, endermen, zombies, skeletons, etc., but not sheep, pigs or cows.

creator: bensku
title: Last Damage Cause
description: Cause of last damage done to an entity

creator: bensku
title: Glowing
description: Indicates if targeted entity is glowing (new 1.9 effect) or not. Glowing entities can be seen through walls.

creator: bensku
title: Unbreakable Items
description: Creates breakable or unbreakable copies of given items.

creator: bensku
title: Coordinate
description: Represents a given coordinate of a location.

creator: bensku
title: Light Level
description:
Gets the light level at a certain location which ranges from 0 to 15.
It can be separated into sunlight (15 = direct sunlight, 1-14 = indirect) and block light (torches, glowstone, etc.). The total light level of a block is the maximum of the two different light types.

creator: bensku
title: Lore
description: An item's lore.
syntax_pattern:
[the] lore of %itemstack/itemtype%
%itemstack/itemtype%'[s] lore
[the] line %number% of [the] lore of %itemstack/itemtype%
[the] line %number% of %itemstack/itemtype%'[s] lore
[the] %number%(st|nd|rd|th) line of [the] lore of %itemstack/itemtype%
[the] %number%(st|nd|rd|th) line of %itemstack/itemtype%'[s] lore

creator: bensku
title: Chunk
description: Returns the chunk of a block, location or entity is in, or a list of the loaded chunks of a world.
syntax_pattern:
[(all [[of] the]|the)] chunk[s] (of|%directions%) %locations%
%locations%'[s] chunk[s]
[(all [[of] the]|the)] loaded chunks (of|in) %worlds%

creator: bensku
title: Book Author
description: The author of a book.

creator: bensku
title: Ender Chest
description: The ender chest of a player.

creator: bensku
title: Sign Text
description: A line of text on a sign. Can be changed, but remember that there is a 16 character limit per line (including color codes that use 2 characters each).

creator: bensku
title: Player Skull
description: Gets a skull item representing a player. Skulls for other entities are provided by the aliases.

creator: bensku
title: Cursor Slot
description: The item which the player has on their inventory cursor. This slot is always empty if player has no inventory open.

creator: bensku
title: Gliding State
description: Sets of gets gliding state of player. It allows you to set gliding state of entity even if they do not have an Elytra equipped.

creator: bensku
title: X of Item
description: An expression to be able to use a certain amount of items where the amount can be any expression. Please note that this expression is not stable and might be replaced in the future.

creator: bensku
title: On Server Start/Stop
description: Called when the server starts or stops (actually, when Skript starts or stops, so a /reload will trigger these events as well).

creator: bensku
title: On Form
description: Called when a block is created, but not by a player, e.g. snow forms due to snowfall, water freezes in cold biomes. This isn't called when block spreads (mushroom growth, water physics etc.), as it has its own event (see spread event).

creator: bensku
title: On Spawn
description: Called when an entity spawns (excluding players).
event_values: event-command sender, event-entity, event-entity type, event-item stack, event-location, event-projectile, event-spawn reason, event-world

creator: bensku
title: On Target
description: Called when a mob starts/stops following/attacking another entity, usually a player.
event_values: event-command sender, event-entity, event-entity type, event-location, event-world

creator: bensku
title: On Gamemode Change
description: Called when a player's gamemode changes.

creator: bensku
title: On Ignition
description:
Called when a block starts burning, i.e. a fire block is placed next to it and this block is flammable.
The burn event will be called when the block is about do be destroyed by the fire.

creator: bensku
title: On Piston Extend
description: Called when a piston is about to extend.

creator: bensku
title: On Piston Retract
description: Called when a piston is about to retract.

creator: bensku
title: On Redstone
description: Called when the redstone current of a block changes. This event is of not much use yet.

creator: bensku
title: On Spread
description: Called when a new block forms as a result of a block that can spread, e.g. water or mushrooms.

creator: bensku
title: On Chunk Generate
description: Called after a new chunk was generated.

creator: bensku
title: On Creeper Power
description: Called when a creeper is struck by lighting and gets powered. Cancel the event to prevent the creeper from being powered.

creator: bensku
title: On Zombie Break Door
description: Called when a zombie is done breaking a wooden door. Can be cancelled to prevent the zombie from breaking the door.
event_values: event-block, event-block data, event-command sender, event-entity, event-location, event-world, future event-block data, past event-block

creator: bensku
title: On Combust
description: Called when an entity is set on fire, e.g. by fire or lava, a fireball, or by standing in direct sunlight (zombies, skeletons).

creator: bensku
title: On Explode
description: Called when an entity (a primed TNT or a creeper) explodes.

creator: bensku
title: On Tame
description: Called when a player tames a wolf or ocelot. Can be cancelled to prevent the entity from being tamed.

creator: bensku
title: On Smelt
description: Called when a furnace smelts an item in its input slot.

creator: bensku
title: On Leaves Decay
description: Called when a leaf block decays due to not being connected to a tree.

creator: bensku
title: On Lightning Strike
description: Called when lightning strikes.

creator: bensku
title: On Bucket fill
description: Called when a player fills a bucket.

creator: bensku
title: On Slime Split
description: Called when a slime splits. Usually this happens when a big slime dies.

creator: bensku
title: On Level Change
description: Called when a player's level changes, e.g. by gathering experience or by enchanting something.

creator: bensku
title: On Portal
description: Called when a player uses a nether or end portal. Cancel the event to prevent the player from teleporting.
event_values: event-block, event-chunk, event-location, event-player, event-teleport cause, event-world, past event-chunk, past event-location

creator: bensku
title: On Quit
description: Called when a player leaves the server.

creator: bensku
title: On Shoot
description: Called whenever a projectile is shot. Use the shooter expression to get who shot the projectile.

creator: bensku
title: On Spawn Change
description: Called when the spawn point of a world changes.

creator: bensku
title: On Vehicle Create
description: Called when a new vehicle is created, e.g. when a player places a boat or minecart.

creator: bensku
title: On Vehicle Damage
description: Called when a vehicle gets damage. Too much damage will destroy the vehicle.

creator: bensku
title: On Vehicle Enter
description: Called when an entity enters a vehicle, either deliberately (players) or by falling into them (mobs).

creator: bensku
title: On Vehicle Exit
description: Called when an entity exits a vehicle.

creator: bensku
title: On World Load
description: Called when a world is loaded. As with the world init event, this event will not be called for the server's default world(s).

creator: bensku
title: On World Unload
description: Called when a world is unloaded. This event will never be called if you don't have a world management plugin.

creator: bensku
title: On Inventory Open
description: Called when an inventory is opened for player.

creator: bensku
title: On Inventory Close
description: Called when player's currently viewed inventory is closed.

creator: bensku
title: On Resurrect Attempt
description: Called when an entity dies, always. If they are not holding a totem, this is cancelled - you can, however, uncancel it.
event_values: event-command sender, event-entity, event-location, event-slot, event-world

creator: bensku
title: On Player World Change
description: Called when a player enters a world. Does not work with other entities!

creator: bensku
title: On Move On
description:
Called when a player moves onto a certain type of block.
Please note that using this event can cause lag if there are many players online.
event_values: event-block, event-chunk, event-location, event-player, event-teleport cause, event-world, past event-chunk, past event-location

creator: bensku
title: On Script Load/Unload
description:
Called directly after the trigger is loaded, or directly before the whole script is unloaded.
The keyword 'async' indicates the trigger can be ran asynchronously,

creator: bensku
title: On Weather Change
description: Called when a world's weather changes.

creator: bensku
title: On First Join
description: Called when a player joins the server for the first time.

creator: bensku
title: On Region Enter/Leave
description:
Called when a player enters or leaves a region.
This event requires a supported regions plugin to be installed.

creator: bensku
title: Vectors - Rotate Around Vector
description: Rotates one or more vectors around another vector

creator: bensku
title: Delay
description: Delays the script's execution by a given timespan. Please note that delays are not persistent, e.g. trying to create a tempban script with ban player → wait 7 days → unban player will not work if you restart your server anytime within these 7 days. You also have to be careful even when using small delays!

creator: bensku
title: Force Respawn
description: Forces player(s) to respawn if they are dead. If this is called without delay from death event, one tick is waited before respawn attempt.

creator: bensku
title: Cancel Event
description: Cancels the event (e.g. prevent blocks from being placed, or damage being taken).

creator: Blueyescat
title: Hidden Players
description: The players hidden from a player that were hidden using the entity visibility effect.
syntax_pattern:
[(all [[of] the]|the)] hidden players (of|for) %players%
[(all [[of] the]|the)] players hidden (from|for|by) %players%

creator: eyesniper2
title: Experience Pickup Cooldown
description:
The experience cooldown of a player.
Experience cooldown is how long until a player can pick up another orb of experience.
The cooldown of a player must be 0 to pick up another orb of experience.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Experience Cooldown Change Reason
description: The experience change reason within an experience cooldown change event.

creator: bensku
title: Experience
description: How much experience was spawned in an experience spawn or block break event. Can be changed.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Barter Input
description: The item picked up by the piglin in a piglin bartering event.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Barter Drops
description: The items dropped by the piglin in a piglin bartering event.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Tame / Untame
description: Tame a tameable entity (horse, parrot, cat, etc.).

creator: eyesniper2
title: Sort
description:
Sorts a list variable using either the natural ordering of the contents or the results of the given expression.
Be warned, this will overwrite the indices of the list variable.

When using the full sort %~objects% (by|based on) <expression> pattern,
the input expression can be used to refer to the current item being sorted.
(See input expression for more information.)

creator: eyesniper2
title: Open/Close Lid
description: Open or close the lid of the block(s).

creator: Blueyescat
title: Locally Suppress Warning
description: Suppresses target warnings from the current script.
syntax_pattern: [local[ly]] suppress [the] (conflict|variable save|[missing] conjunction|starting [with] expression[s]|deprecated syntax|unreachable code) warning[s]

creator: bensku
title: Exit
description: Exits a given amount of loops and conditionals, or the entire trigger.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Entity Visibility
description:
Change visibility of the given entities for the given players.
If no players are given, will hide the entities from all online players.

When reveal is used in combination of the hidden players expression and the viewers are not specified, this will default it to the given player in the hidden players expression.

Note: all previously hidden entities (including players) will be visible when a player leaves and rejoins.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Conditional / Unconditional
description: Sets whether the provided command blocks are conditional or not.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Charge Entity
description: Charges or uncharges a creeper or wither skull. A creeper is charged when it has been struck by lightning.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Is Tamed
description: Check if a tameable entity is tamed (horse, parrot, cat, etc.).

creator: eyesniper2
title: concat
description: Joins the provided texts (and other things) into a single text.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Timespan Details
description: Retrieve specific information of a timespan such as hours/minutes/etc.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Ringing Time
description:
Returns the ringing time of a bell.
A bell typically rings for 50 game ticks.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Resonating Time
description:
Returns the resonating time of a bell.
A bell will start resonating five game ticks after being rung, and will continue to resonate for 40 game ticks.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Character from Codepoint
description: Returns the character at the specified codepoint

creator: eyesniper2
title: Character Codepoint
description: Returns the Unicode codepoint of a character

creator: eyesniper2
title: Ring Bell
description:
Causes a bell to ring.
Optionally, the entity that rang the bell and the direction the bell should ring can be specified.
A bell can only ring in two directions, and the direction is determined by which way the bell is facing.
By default, the bell will ring in the direction it is facing.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Enforce Whitelist
description:
Enforces or un-enforce a server's whitelist.
All non-whitelisted players will be kicked upon enforcing the whitelist.

creator: eyesniper2
title: Is Whitelisted
description: Whether or not the server or a player is whitelisted, or the server is whitelist enforced.
syntax_pattern:
[the] server (is|(isn't|is not)) (in white[ ]list mode|white[ ]listed)
%offlineplayers% (is|are|(isn't|is not|aren't|are not)) white[ ]listed
[the] server white[ ]list (is|(isn't|is not)) enforced

creator: eyesniper2
title: Is Pathfinding
description:
Checks whether living entities are pathfinding.
Can only be a living entity that is a Mob.

creator: bensku
title: Kick
description: Kicks a player from the server.
syntax_pattern: kick %players% [(by reason of|because [of]|on account of|due to) %string%]

creator: bensku
title: op/deop
description: Grant/revoke a user operator state.

creator: bensku
title: Spawn
description: Spawn a creature.

creator: bensku
title: Ignite/Extinguish
description: Lights entities on fire or extinguishes them.

creator: bensku
title: Vectors - Rotate around XYZ
description: Rotates one or more vectors around the x, y, or z axis by some amount of degrees

creator: bensku
title: Tree
description:
Creates a tree.
This may require that there is enough space above the given location and that the block below is dirt/grass, but it is possible that the tree will just grow anyways, possibly replacing every block in its path.

creator: bensku
title: Shoot
description: Shoots a projectile (or any other entity) from a given entity.

creator: bensku
title: Enchant/Disenchant
description: Enchant or disenchant an existing item.

creator: bensku
title: PvP
description: Set the PvP state for a given world.

creator: bensku
title: Return
description: Makes a trigger or a section (e.g. a function) return a value

creator: bensku
title: Log
description:
Writes text into a .log file. Skript will write these files to /plugins/Skript/logs.
NB: Using 'server.log' as the log file will write to the default server log. Omitting the log file altogether will log the message as '[Skript] [<script>.sk] <message>' in the server log.

creator: bensku
title: Toggle
description: Toggle the state of a block or boolean.

creator: bensku
title: Poison/Cure
description: Poison or cure a creature.

creator: bensku
title: Is on Ground
description: Checks whether an entity is on ground.
syntax_pattern:
%entities% (is|are) on [the] ground
%entities% (isn't|is not|aren't|are not) on [the] ground

creator: bensku
title: Exists/Is Set
description: Checks whether a given expression or variable is set.

creator: bensku
title: Is Online
description: Checks whether a player is online. The 'connected' pattern will return false once this player leaves the server, even if they rejoin. Be aware that using the 'connected' pattern with a variable will not have this special behavior. Use the direct event-player or other non-variable expression for best results.

creator: bensku
title: PvP
description: Checks the PvP state of a world.
syntax_pattern:
(is PvP|PvP is) enabled [in %worlds%]
(is PvP|PvP is) disabled [in %worlds%]

creator: bensku
title: Is Banned
description: Checks whether a player or IP is banned.
syntax_pattern:
%offlineplayers/strings% (is|are) banned
%players/strings% (is|are) IP(-| |)banned
%offlineplayers/strings% (isn't|is not|aren't|are not) banned
%players/strings% (isn't|is not|aren't|are not) IP(-| |)banned

creator: bensku
title: Is Burning
description: Checks whether an entity is on fire, e.g. a zombie due to being in sunlight, or any entity after falling into lava.

creator: bensku
title: Is Empty
description: Checks whether an inventory, an inventory slot, a queue, or a text is empty.

creator: bensku
title: Is Flying
description: Checks whether a player is flying.

creator: bensku
title: Is in World
description: Checks whether an entity is in a specific world.
syntax_pattern:
%entities% (is|are) in [[the] world[s]] %worlds%
%entities% (isn't|is not|aren't|are not) in [[the] world[s]] %worlds%

creator: bensku
title: Is Poisoned
description: Checks whether an entity is poisoned.

creator: bensku
title: Time
description: Tests whether a given real time was more or less than some time span ago.
syntax_pattern:
%date% (was|were)( more|(n't| not) less) than %timespan% [ago]
%date% (was|were)((n't| not) more| less) than %timespan% [ago]

creator: bensku
title: Is Script Loaded
description: Check if the current script, or another script, is currently loaded.
syntax_pattern:
script[s] [%strings%] (is|are) loaded
script[s] [%strings%] (isn't|is not|aren't|are not) loaded

creator: bensku
title: Is Sprinting
description: Checks whether a player is sprinting.

creator: bensku
title: Is Sneaking
description: Checks whether a player is sneaking.

creator: bensku
title: Is Wearing
description: Checks whether an entity is wearing some items (usually armor).

creator: bensku
title: Weather
description:
Checks whether the weather in a world is of a specific type.
I welcome any ideas how to write this condition differently.

creator: bensku
title: Is Member/Owner of Region
description:
Checks whether a player is a member or owner of a particular region.
This condition requires a supported regions plugin to be installed.
syntax_pattern:
%offlineplayers% (is|are) ([a] member|[(the|an)] owner) of [[the] region] %regions%
%offlineplayers% (is|are)(n't| not) ([a] member|[(the|an)] owner) of [[the] region] %regions%
